original: sems dri ma can du byed pa ste kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skye ba'i gegs byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyed pa rnams las yongs su nyams par byed pa dang / gang gis ngan song rnams su yun ring por 'gro bar gyur pa de 'dra ba'i mi dge ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems dri ma can du byed pa ste kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skye ba'i gegs byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyed pa rnams las yongs su nyams par byed pa dang / gang gis ngan song rnams su yun ring por 'gro bar gyur pa de 'dra ba'i mi dge ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa'o //

original: de'i phyir nang gi dri ma yin /üîΩnang gi 'gran zla dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi dri ma yin / nang gi 'gran zla dang bcas pa yin /

original: nang gi phyir rgol ba yin /
analyzed: nang gi phyir rgol ba yin /
translated: It is an internal adversary.

original: nang gi dgra bo yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nang gi dgra bo yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is an internal enemy.

original: go rims bzhin no /
analyzed: go rims bzhin no /
translated: in due order.

original: de ni mig gi rgya mtsho dba' rlabs dang bcas pa glong dang bcas pa 'dzin khri dang bcas pa srin po dang bcas pa las brgal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //

translated: He has crossed over the ocean of the eye, with its waves, its billows, its whirlpools, and its monsters. This is a passage from a Sutra.

original: de la dba' rlabs zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: de la dba' rlabs zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa can yin te /

original: sems kun tu 'khrugs par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩglong ni nyon mongs pa gang gis bslabs pa btang nas nyams par bya ba'i phyir gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems kun tu 'khrugs par byed pa'i phyir ro // glong ni nyon mongs pa gang gis bslabs pa btang nas nyams par bya ba'i phyir gnas pa'o //
translated: They are so called because they disturb the mind.üîΩThe ‚Äúbillows‚Äù are the afflictions by which one is carried away and destroyed.

original: 'dzin khri ni nyon mongs pa gang gis rnyed pa dang bkur sti la bying bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin khri ni nyon mongs pa gang gis rnyed pa dang bkur sti la bying bar byed pa'o //

original: srin po ni gang gis 'chal pa'i tshul khrims bskyed nas ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: srin po ni gang gis 'chal pa'i tshul khrims bskyed nas ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúsea monster‚Äù is the affliction by which one generates immorality and is reborn in the miserable planes of existence.

original: de ltar na bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung ba'i mig gis bdag po byas na chud za ba gzhi dang bcas pa rnam pa gnyis yang dag par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung ba'i mig gis bdag po byas na chud za ba gzhi dang bcas pa rnam pa gnyis yang dag par bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, in this teaching, the two kinds of loss with their bases are shown to be the two eyes of the religious life.

original: bslab pa gtang ba dang nyams bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa gtang ba dang nyams bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They are the loss of the training and the loss of the practice.

original: shes rab myur ba shes rab mgyogs pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: shes rab myur ba shes rab mgyogs pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSwift wisdom‚Äù and ‚Äúquick wisdom‚Äù are two verses from a s≈´tra.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la don myur ba dang / mang po dang / phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab myur ba dang mgyogs pa dang rno ba yin te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la don myur ba dang / mang po dang / phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab myur ba dang mgyogs pa dang rno ba yin te go rims bzhin no //
translated: The wisdom of the Tathagata is swift, quick, and sharp, because it penetrates the meaning of the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathagata, which is profound, extensive, and subtle, respectively.

original: mang po dag tu 'gro ba la ni mgyogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mang po dag tu 'gro ba la ni mgyogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is quick in penetrating the profound, swift in penetrating the extensive, and sharp in penetrating the subtle.

original: 'di la shes rab 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba dang de kho na nges par 'byed pa yod pas nges par 'byung ba'i shes @71a * //
analyzed: 'di la shes rab 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba dang de kho na nges par 'byed pa yod pas nges par 'byung ba'i shes @71a * //
translated: It is called wisdom of deliverance because it is deliverance from cyclic existence and the discernment of reality.

original: shes rab can yin no //
analyzed: shes rab can yin no //
translated: He is the one who has wisdom.

original: 'di la shes rab chen po yod de /
analyzed: 'di la shes rab chen po yod de /
translated: He has great wisdom,

original: 'dri ba dang lan gdab pa dag la phugs thug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dri ba dang lan gdab pa dag la phugs thug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not exhausted in asking questions and answering them.

original: yangs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yangs pa yang yin te /
translated: It is vast,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga rgya che ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga rgya che ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the five superknowledges are extensive and complete.

original: zab pa yang yin te /
analyzed: zab pa yang yin te /
translated: It is profound,

original: gzhan dag gis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult for others to understand.

original: mnyam pa med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa yang yin te /
translated: It is unequaled,üîΩbecause it is not similar to the wisdom of others.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior to all mundane states.

original: rin po che lta bu yang yin te /
analyzed: rin po che lta bu yang yin te /
translated: It is also like a jewel,

original: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir dang / don chen po yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir dang / dga' bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir dang / don chen po yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir dang / dga' bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is difficult to obtain, because it accomplishes the great meaning, and because it delights.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la rnam par grol ba dang dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la rnam par grol ba dang dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir shes rab che ba /üîΩshes rab yangs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab che ba / shes rab yangs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is endowed with great wisdom,üîΩvast wisdom,

original: shes rab zab pa /
analyzed: shes rab zab pa /
translated: profound wisdom,

original: shes rab mnyam pa med pa /
analyzed: shes rab mnyam pa med pa /
translated: unequaled wisdom,

original: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa yin te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa yin te go rims bzhin no //
translated: and precious wisdom, respectively.

original: 'dir gnyi ga'i don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i chos kyi don la brtsams nas shes rab kyi yon tan gsum dag tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gnyi ga'i don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i chos kyi don la brtsams nas shes rab kyi yon tan gsum dag tu rig par bya'o //

original: gnyis ni rang gi don ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni rang gi don ste /
translated: Two are for one's own benefit,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: lhag ma rnams ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gzhan gyi don yin te /

original: the tshom gcod pa'i phyir dang / 'dud pa'i phyir dang / ri mo'i khyad par skyed pa'i phyir dang / don gyi mchog thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom gcod pa'i phyir dang / 'dud pa'i phyir dang / ri mo'i khyad par skyed pa'i phyir dang / don gyi mchog thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: zab pa dang mnyam pa med pa gnyis kyi ni ri mo'i khyad par skyed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zab pa dang mnyam pa med pa gnyis kyi ni ri mo'i khyad par skyed pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig 'di dag gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, these words were spoken with reference to the noble Shariputra.

original: de la shes rab myur ba ni tshe dang ldan pa rta thul las lan cig tshigs su bcad pa thos pas don la zhugs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shes rab myur ba ni tshe dang ldan pa rta thul las lan cig tshigs su bcad pa thos pas don la zhugs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, swift wisdom is that of the Venerable Ashvajit, because he engaged in the meaning by hearing a single verse.

original: shes rab mgyogs pa ni de thos pa na don mang po la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab mgyogs pa ni de thos pa na don mang po la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Quick wisdom is that of Maudgalyayana, because he engaged in many meanings when he heard it.

original: shes rab rno ba ni don phra ba la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab rno ba ni don phra ba la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sharp wisdom is that of Shariputra, because he engaged in subtle meanings.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab can nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can ni de nyid las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab can nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can ni de nyid las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob pa'i phyir te /

original: nyon nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: shes rab che @71b ba ni ji skad du bdag ni dri ba dris na don 'di kho na yang nyin mtshan bdun du tshig gzhan dang yig 'bru gzhan dag gis lan 'debs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: shes rab che @71b ba ni ji skad du bdag ni dri ba dris na don 'di kho na yang nyin mtshan bdun du tshig gzhan dang yig 'bru gzhan dag gis lan 'debs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Those with great wisdom are like the one who said, ‚ÄúIf I am asked a question, I can answer it for seven days and nights with different words and different letters.‚Äù

analyzed: shes rab yangs pa ni rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan byed pa'i phyir te /

original: ji skad bu skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pas skyes bu gdul ba thul ba na phyogs thams cad du rnam par rgyug par byed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //

translated: like the one who said, ‚ÄúWhen the unsurpassed trainer of beings tames beings, he runs in all directions.‚Äù

original: 'o na mdo sde las 'di la dge slong 'dod pa dag las dben pa nas /
analyzed: 'o na mdo sde las 'di la dge slong 'dod pa dag las dben pa nas /
translated: But a sutra says, ‚ÄúHere, monks, having abandoned desire...

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar la snyoms par zhugs te gnas na 'di tsam gyis /
translated: If he enters and abides in the fourth meditation,

analyzed: dge slong mkhas pa yid gzhungs pa shes rab yangs pa zhes bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: he is called a wise, intelligent, and greatly wise monk.

original: de yang bsam gtan rnams la mngon par shes pa dang rnam par thar pa rten pa nyid kyi phyir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bsam gtan rnams la mngon par shes pa dang rnam par thar pa rten pa nyid kyi phyir rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the support of the higher knowledge and liberation in the meditations.

original: shes rab zab pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: shes rab zab pa ni ji skad du /
translated: Deep wisdom is as stated:

original: khyod ni ci la gnas te bsam gtan pa //
analyzed: khyod ni ci la gnas te bsam gtan pa //
translated: Where do you abide in meditation?

original: khyod la mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur bas //üîΩskyes bu cang shes khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: khyod la mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur bas // skyes bu cang shes khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: What is not realized by you?üîΩI pay homage to you, O wise one!

original: skyes bu dam pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: I pay homage to you, O holy one!

original: shes rab mnyam pa med pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: shes rab mnyam pa med pa ni ji skad du /
translated: Wisdom without equal is as stated:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa //
translated: Except for the TathƒÅgata,

original: 'jig rten kun gyi shes rab gang //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyi shes rab gang //
translated: all the wisdom in the worldüîΩdoes not equal one-sixteenth

original: sh'a ri'i bu yi shes rab kyi //üîΩbcu drug char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu yi shes rab kyi //üîΩbcu drug char yang mi phod do //
translated: of ≈öƒÅriputra's wisdom.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said:

original: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa ni de'i shes rab rin po che lta bu yin pa'i phyir te snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa ni de'i shes rab rin po che lta bu yin pa'i phyir te snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The one who possesses the jewel of wisdom is like the jewel of his wisdom, as before.

original: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni bdag ni skye dgu ser sna'i dri mas kun nas dkris pa rnams las sems dri ma'i ser sna dang bral bas lhug par gtong ba dang lag pa brkyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum
analyzed: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni bdag ni skye dgu ser sna'i dri mas kun nas dkris pa rnams las sems dri ma'i ser sna dang bral bas lhug par gtong ba dang lag pa brkyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum
translated: Here, the noble disciple who is learned is free from the stain of stinginess, which is a mental stain, among those who are bound by the stain of stinginess. He is relaxed in giving, with open hands, as stated in the sutra.

original: bu'o // de la dri ma gang las ser sna 'byung ba de'i rgyu de ni ser sna'i dri ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bu'o // de la dri ma gang las ser sna 'byung ba de'i rgyu de ni ser sna'i dri ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the cause of the stinginess that arises from the stain is called the stain of stinginess.

original: sbyin pa dang 'gal ba chags pa'i rnam pa yin pas 'bras bu'i shing lta bu dang ser ba'i sprin lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang 'gal ba chags pa'i rnam pa yin pas 'bras bu'i shing lta bu dang ser ba'i sprin lta bu'o //
translated: It is a form of attachment that is contrary to generosity, like a fruit tree and a hail cloud.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems dri ma'i ser sna dang bral ba zhes bzlog nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems dri ma'i ser sna dang bral ba zhes bzlog nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said in reverse: ‚Äúfree from the stain of stinginess, which is a mental stain.‚Äù

original: ser sna'i rgyu chags pa dang sdar bral ba'i @72a * //
analyzed: ser sna'i rgyu chags pa dang sdar bral ba'i @72a * //
translated: because he is free from attachment and avarice, which are the causes of stinginess.

original: phyir ro // de ltar na ser sna sngar dang phyi nas smos pa ni khyad par du bya ba'i phyir dang / ldog pa'i go rims yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlhug par gtong ba dang / lag pa brkyang ba dang / rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba dang / sbyin pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa la 'ged par dga' ba dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi gnas par sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: phyir ro // de ltar na ser sna sngar dang phyi nas smos pa ni khyad par du bya ba'i phyir dang / ldog pa'i go rims yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro // lhug par gtong ba dang / lag pa brkyang ba dang / rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba dang / sbyin pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa la 'ged par dga' ba dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi gnas par sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang /
translated: Thus, the order of the first and last is for the purpose of distinguishing and correctly teaching the order of the opposites.üîΩThis generosity is shown by the following six types: (1) openhanded, (2) openpalmed, (3) delighting in giving, (4) uninterrupted generosity, (5) perfect generosity, and (6) generosity that is not attached to the gift.

original: rgya cher sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang / dga' bas sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang / yang dang yang du sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang / log par 'tsho ba med par sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang / phyogs med par sbyin pa byed pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: rgya cher sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang / dga' bas sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang / yang dang yang du sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang / log par 'tsho ba med par sbyin pa byed pa nyid dang / phyogs med par sbyin pa byed pa nyid ston to //
translated: These six types of generosity are shown by the following six verses.

original: mi gnas par sbyin pa nyid ni lan dang rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas par sbyin pa nyid ni lan dang rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Giving without attachment should be understood as not desiring a return or the ripening of the result.

original: phyogs med par byed pa nyid ni dge sbyong rnams las slong mo pa rnams kyi bar dag la kun tu 'ged pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs med par byed pa nyid ni dge sbyong rnams las slong mo pa rnams kyi bar dag la kun tu 'ged pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Giving without discrimination is giving to mendicants, etc. up to those who are despised.

original: de la rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i zas la tshod zin pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i zas la tshod zin pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: In this regard, son of noble family, moderation in food is this: this is a passage from a sutra.

original: so sor brtags nas zas za'o zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: so sor brtags nas zas za'o zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin la /
translated: One should eat food after careful consideration.üîΩThis is the teaching.

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa yin no //
translated: The rest is the explanation.

original: de la kha cig na re da ni longs pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni gzhon nu rnams lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re da ni longs pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni gzhon nu rnams lta bu ste /
translated: In this regard, some say: Not for enjoyment, like young children.

original: de rnams ni dgod pa dang rtsed mo'i bsam pa nyid kyis longs pa'i phyir za'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni dgod pa dang rtsed mo'i bsam pa nyid kyis longs pa'i phyir za'o //
translated: They eat for the sake of play and amusement.

original: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni gyad rnams lta bu ste /
analyzed: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni gyad rnams lta bu ste /
translated: Not for intoxication, like wrestlers.

original: de rnams ni lus kyi stobs brtas par bya ba dang / yeng yeng por bya ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis rgyags pa'i phyir za'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni lus kyi stobs brtas par bya ba dang / yeng yeng por bya ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis rgyags pa'i phyir za'o //
translated: They eat in order to be intoxicated, because they are intoxicated by the idea of strengthening the body and of being distracted.

original: cha ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: cha ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: They do not eat in order to be beautiful.

original: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams lta bu ste /
analyzed: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams lta bu ste /
translated: They do not eat in order to adorn themselves, like those who enjoy the pleasures of desire.

original: de rnams ni mdzes par bya ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis cha ba'i phyir dang / brgyan pa'i phyir za'o //üîΩde la khrus dang byi dor byed pa dang nyug pa ni cha ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni mdzes par bya ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis cha ba'i phyir dang / brgyan pa'i phyir za'o // de la khrus dang byi dor byed pa dang nyug pa ni cha ba'o //
translated: They eat in order to be beautiful and to adorn themselves.

original: gos dang phred ba dang rin po ches klubs pa ni brgyan pa'o zhes kyang zer te /
analyzed: gos dang phred ba dang rin po ches klubs pa ni brgyan pa'o zhes kyang zer te /
translated: They say that to be beautiful is to be well-proportioned, and to adorn oneself is to be well-decorated.üîΩBut all this is only found among those who enjoy the pleasures of desire.

original: 'di thams cad ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kho na dag la 'byung bas de lta bu'i bsam pas zas kyi bya ba 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kho na dag la 'byung bas de lta bu'i bsam pas zas kyi bya ba 'gog par byed do //
translated: Thus, one should stop eating with such intentions.

original: lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig srog yod @72b par bya ba'i phyir dang / stobs yod par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig srog yod @72b par bya ba'i phyir dang / stobs yod par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: For the sake of maintaining and nourishing this very body, for the sake of its life and strength,

original: shing rta'i srog shing bsku ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shing rta'i srog shing bsku ba bzhin no //
translated: like the axle of a chariot.

original: bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni za 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni za 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: For the sake of freedom from hunger, for the sake of averting the suffering of desire to eat,

original: rma bsku ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rma bsku ba bzhin no //
translated: like the axle of a chariot.

original: tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus gnas pa dang / lus kyi stobs dang lus kyi nyon mongs pa med pa de dag la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus gnas pa dang / lus kyi stobs dang lus kyi nyon mongs pa med pa de dag la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: For the sake of maintaining chaste conduct, for the sake of establishing the noble path in dependence on the maintenance of the body, the strength of the body, and the absence of physical afflictions,

original: tshangs par spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is chaste conduct?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o zhes mdo sde gzhan dag las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o zhes mdo sde gzhan dag las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the noble path with eight parts.

original: de lta bu'i tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la zhes bya ba ni bkres pas kun nas bslang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la zhes bya ba ni bkres pas kun nas bslang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase the old feeling is removed refers to the feeling that arises from being motivated by hunger.

original: tshor ba gsar ni mi skye bar byas nas zhes bya ba ni ha cang bza' drags pa las skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba gsar ni mi skye bar byas nas zhes bya ba ni ha cang bza' drags pa las skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase the new feeling is not produced refers to the feeling that arises from overeating.

original: 'dis ni zas chung du dang lhag par za ba yongs su spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni zas chung du dang lhag par za ba yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: This passage shows the avoidance of eating too little and eating excessively.

original: de lta bus zhes bya ba ni tshod yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bus zhes bya ba ni tshod yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in this way indicates the proper measure of food.

original: tshor ba rnying bcil bas cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: tshor ba rnying bcil bas cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: What is the benefit of removing the old feeling?

original: bdag 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang bde bar 'gyur ro snyam du so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: bdag 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang bde bar 'gyur ro snyam du so sor rtog ste /
translated: The text states, One's life, strength, and happiness are promoted.

original: de dag kyang lus gnas pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang lus gnas pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: These benefits are the same as those described earlier as the purpose of maintaining the body.

original: tsho rab gsar mi bskyed na cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: tsho rab gsar mi bskyed na cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: What is the benefit of not producing the new feeling?

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / reg par gnas par 'gyur ro snyam du so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / reg par gnas par 'gyur ro snyam du so sor rtog ste /
translated: The text states, One remains free of misfortune and lives at ease.

original: de dag kyang tshangs par spyod pa rjes su bzung ba ltar sngar bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshangs par spyod pa rjes su bzung ba ltar sngar bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: And these are the same as those previously mentioned, which are to be followed by one who practices pure conduct.

original: de la ha cang bza' drags pa'i skyon med pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ha cang bza' drags pa'i skyon med pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therein, one should understand that it is free from blame because it is free from the fault of overeating.

original: de la skyon ni lnga dag ste /
analyzed: de la skyon ni lnga dag ste /
translated: Therein, the five faults are:

original: snyoms pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / glal ba dang / zas kyis gsung pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid do //
analyzed: snyoms pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / glal ba dang / zas kyis gsung pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid do //
translated: sloth, lack of joy, yawning, satiety from food, and mental depression.

original: lus zo mdog bde bas shin tu sbyangs pa dang mthun pa nyid kyis bde bar gnas pa'i phyir reg par gnas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus zo mdog bde bas shin tu sbyangs pa dang mthun pa nyid kyis bde bar gnas pa'i phyir reg par gnas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is comfortable because it is conducive to pliancy due to the comfort of the body's complexion.

original: de ltar na bsam pa gang gis mi bza' ba dang bsam pa gang gis dang / tshod ci tsam du bza' ba dang / zas la tshod zin pa'i phan yon gang yin ba de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas zas @73a * //
analyzed: de ltar na bsam pa gang gis mi bza' ba dang bsam pa gang gis dang / tshod ci tsam du bza' ba dang / zas la tshod zin pa'i phan yon gang yin ba de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas zas @73a * //
translated: Thus, one eats food after careful consideration, because one eats food after considering with which intention one should not eat, with which intention and to what extent one should eat, and the benefits of moderation in eating.

original: za ba yin no //
analyzed: za ba yin no //
translated: Thus, one eats food after careful consideration.

original: gzhan dag na re so sor brtags pa bzhi dag gis so sor brtags nas yin zhes zer te /üîΩso sor brtags pa bzhi la spang bar bya ba so sor brtags pa ni tshig bzhi dag gis so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re so sor brtags pa bzhi dag gis so sor brtags nas yin zhes zer te / so sor brtags pa bzhi la spang bar bya ba so sor brtags pa ni tshig bzhi dag gis so //
translated: The four investigations are:üîΩ1. the investigation of what is to be abandoned, by the first four phrases;

original: tshod so sor brtags pa yang bzhi dag gis so //
analyzed: tshod so sor brtags pa yang bzhi dag gis so //
translated: 2. the investigation of the measure, by the next four;

original: tshod bzung ba so sor brtags pa ni gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: tshod bzung ba so sor brtags pa ni gnyis kyis so //
translated: 3. the investigation of the measure of what is grasped, by the next two;

original: tshod zin pa'i phan yon so sor brtags pa ni lhag ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: tshod zin pa'i phan yon so sor brtags pa ni lhag ma rnams kyis so //
translated: 4. the investigation of the benefit of grasping the measure, by the rest.

original: yang ni tshig bzhi dag gis ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' yongs su spong ba yin la gsum dag gis ni bdag nyid dub par gnas pa la rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' spong ba yin no //
analyzed: yang ni tshig bzhi dag gis ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' yongs su spong ba yin la gsum dag gis ni bdag nyid dub par gnas pa la rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' spong ba yin no //
translated: Or, the first four phrases abandon the extreme of engaging in indulgence in desire, the next three abandon the extreme of engaging in self-mortification,

original: gcig gis ni dbu ma'i lam sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig gis ni dbu ma'i lam sgrub pa yin no //
translated: and one establishes the middle way.

original: lnga dag gis ni mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i phan yon rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: lnga dag gis ni mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i phan yon rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: The next five phrases show the benefit of abandoning the two extremes.

original: gnyis kyis ni dbu ma'i lam sgrub pa'i phan yon yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni dbu ma'i lam sgrub pa'i phan yon yin no //
translated: The last two lines show the benefits of practicing the middle way.

original: shing rta'i srog shing dang rma'i dpe gnyis ni sngar sbyar ba kho na'o //
analyzed: shing rta'i srog shing dang rma'i dpe gnyis ni sngar sbyar ba kho na'o //
translated: The two examples of the axle of a chariot and a wound are to be applied as above.

original: de la rigs kyi bu dga' bo dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan ba ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu dga' bo dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan ba ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: Here, son of noble family, the one who is endowed with supreme mindfulness and vigilance is this. This is a passage from the sutra.

original: de la sems thams cad kyis bsams nas rnam par lta ba ni rgyu ba na yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems thams cad kyis bsams nas rnam par lta ba ni rgyu ba na yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: There, the observation of all mental states should be known as occurring in the moving state.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes shes bzhin pa ni bsam gtan pa dang gzugs med pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa la gnas pa na ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes shes bzhin pa ni bsam gtan pa dang gzugs med pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa la gnas pa na ste /
translated: The vigilance of feeling and perception is in the equipoise of the dhyanas and formless [absorptions].

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is in that order.

original: rnam par rtog pa shes bzhin pa ni langs shing mnyam par ma bzhag pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa shes bzhin pa ni langs shing mnyam par ma bzhag pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: The vigilance of conceptualization is in the arisen state, when one is not in equipoise.

original: gzhan yang sems thams cad kyis bsams nas rnam par lta ba ni gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag shes bzhin du skye ba nas gtugs pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems thams cad kyis bsams nas rnam par lta ba ni gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag shes bzhin du skye ba nas gtugs pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when all the mental factors are present, the contact that arises from the coming together of the three, the sensation that arises through the condition of contact, the conception, and the volition, all of these arise with full awareness, up to the cessation of the full awareness.

original: sems pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dir rnam par rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dir rnam par rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of volition is to be understood here as discursive thought.

original: gzhan yang sems thams cad kyis bsam nas rnam par lta ba kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir gzugs dang shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa nyid kyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams la dran ba dang shesüîΩbzhin mchog dang ldan pa nyid yin par yongs su bstan to /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems thams cad kyis bsam nas rnam par lta ba kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir gzugs dang shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa nyid kyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams la dran ba dang shesüîΩbzhin mchog dang ldan pa nyid yin par yongs su bstan to /
translated: Moreover, when all the mental factors are present, the sensation, conception, and volition that arise with full awareness, through the absence of defilement, are taught to be endowed with supreme mindfulness and full awareness, through their arising, etc.

original: de @73b ltar na rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi dag la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa nyid yin par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de @73b ltar na rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi dag la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa nyid yin par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the four abodes of consciousness are endowed with supreme mindfulness and vigilance.

original: de la tshor ba la sogs pa skad cig pa yin yang rgyun dran pa dus gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug pas gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshor ba la sogs pa skad cig pa yin yang rgyun dran pa dus gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug pas gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Although feeling, etc., are momentary, their continuum is mindfulness that continues at other times.

original: thub pa ni dal gyis ma yin par rkyen gyi dbang gis 'phral 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thub pa ni dal gyis ma yin par rkyen gyi dbang gis 'phral 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Sage is not slow, because he immediately ceases through the power of conditions.

original: zad pa dang gtugs par 'gyur ba ni phyi nas dal gyis ma lus par rgyun 'dra ba 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa dang gtugs par 'gyur ba ni phyi nas dal gyis ma lus par rgyun 'dra ba 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is exhausted and terminated, because his similar continuum ceases without remainder later on.

original: dge slong dag rgyal po legs mthong chen po ni ha cang mi grang zhing ha cang mi dro ba dang / dus tshigs bde ba dang / gnod pa med pa dang / gang gis na de zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang /üîΩmyangs pa rnams legs par bde bar 'ju ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag rgyal po legs mthong chen po ni ha cang mi grang zhing ha cang mi dro ba dang / dus tshigs bde ba dang / gnod pa med pa dang / gang gis na de zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang /üîΩmyangs pa rnams legs par bde bar 'ju ste /
translated: Bhik·π£us, MahƒÅpradhƒÅna was not too cold, not too hot, and had pleasant seasons, was not harmful, and by which what he ate, drank, chewed, and tasted was well digested.

original: pho ba'i drod snyoms shing 'ju bar byed pa dang ldan pas gnod pa nyung ba dang / nad med pa'i rang bzhin can du gyur to zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: pho ba'i drod snyoms shing 'ju bar byed pa dang ldan pas gnod pa nyung ba dang / nad med pa'i rang bzhin can du gyur to zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith little illness and naturally healthy‚Äù is a summary of the sutra.

original: de la gnod pa nyung ba ni zas dang / gnas 'phrod pa la sbyor ba dang mngon par brtson pa'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: de la gnod pa nyung ba ni zas dang / gnas 'phrod pa la sbyor ba dang mngon par brtson pa'i phyir yin la /
translated: Here, ‚Äúlittle illness‚Äù means that the body is not subject to much pain because the heat of the stomach is balanced and the food is digested.

original: rang bzhin gyis nad med pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa yang yod /üîΩnad med pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nad med pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa yang yod / nad med pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
translated: There are some who are naturally healthy but not naturally subject to little illness.üîΩThere are some who are naturally subject to little illness but not naturally healthy.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnod pa nyung ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnod pa nyung ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are some who are neither naturally healthy nor naturally subject to little illness.

original: zas dang gnas mi 'phrod pa mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zas dang gnas mi 'phrod pa mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are subject to much food and drink that is not compatible with their bodies.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka brjod pa ni gcig gis gcig khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka brjod pa ni gcig gis gcig khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, both are mentioned in order to distinguish one from the other.

original: de la yang rgyu ni pho ba'i drod snyoms shing 'ju bar byed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas yang dag par snyon te /
analyzed: de la yang rgyu ni pho ba'i drod snyoms shing 'ju bar byed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas yang dag par snyon te /
translated: Here, the cause is stated correctly with the phrase ‚Äúwith the heat of the stomach balanced and the food is digested.‚Äù

original: lus dang bcas pa'i snyoms pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: lus dang bcas pa'i snyoms pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows the balance of the body and the humors.

original: snyoms pa de yang ha cang mi grang zhing ha cang mi dro ba nyid dang dus tshigs bde ba dang / gnod pa med pa dang zhes bya ba sa ston to //
analyzed: snyoms pa de yang ha cang mi grang zhing ha cang mi dro ba nyid dang dus tshigs bde ba dang / gnod pa med pa dang zhes bya ba sa ston to //
translated: This balance is shown to be neither too cold nor too hot, to be a comfortable season, and to be free from harm.

original: 'dis ni ma snyoms pa nyid rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir pho ba'i drod snyoms pa nyid du yang dag par ston to //üîΩma snyoms pa nyid rnam pa gsum la me ma snyoms pa nyid kyis ni des me'i drod chung bas ha cang grang ba'am /
analyzed: 'dis ni ma snyoms pa nyid rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir pho ba'i drod snyoms pa nyid du yang dag par ston to // ma snyoms pa nyid rnam pa gsum la me ma snyoms pa nyid kyis ni des me'i drod chung bas ha cang grang ba'am /
translated: This shows the balance of the humors in the stomach, because there is no absence of balance in any of the three humors.üîΩAbsence of balance in the three humors is due to absence of balance in fire, absence of balance in the seasons, and absence of balance in food.

original: me'i drod ches pas ha cang drod che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me'i drod ches pas ha cang drod che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Absence of balance in fire is due to the weakness of the digestive heat, which makes the body too cold, or to the excess of digestive heat, which makes the body too hot.

original: dus tshigs ma snyoms pa nyid kyis ni des dus tshigs rnams 'pho ba na skyon rnams rab tu 'khrug par byed pa'i phyir mi bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dus tshigs ma snyoms pa nyid kyis ni des dus tshigs rnams 'pho ba na skyon rnams rab tu 'khrug par byed pa'i phyir mi bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Absence of balance in the seasons is due to the fact that when the seasons change, the humors are disturbed and become uncomfortable.

original: @74a * // zas ma snyoms pa nyid kyis ni des zas mi 'phrod pa'i skyon las gnod pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: @74a * // zas ma snyoms pa nyid kyis ni des zas mi 'phrod pa'i skyon las gnod pa skyed pa'o //
translated: Absence of balance in food is due to the fact that indigestible food causes harm.

original: snyoms pa nyid bshad nas /
analyzed: snyoms pa nyid bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the evenness of the body,

original: 'ju bar byed pa nyid ni gang gis na des zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang / myangs pa rnams legs par bde bar 'ju zhes bya bas 'chad de /
analyzed: 'ju bar byed pa nyid ni gang gis na des zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang / myangs pa rnams legs par bde bar 'ju zhes bya bas 'chad de /
translated: he explains the state of being that which digests, by which that which is eaten, drunk, chewed and tasted is well and easily digested.

original: 'dis ni zas kyi rnam pa thams cad dus su ngal ba med par 'ju bar byed pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni zas kyi rnam pa thams cad dus su ngal ba med par 'ju bar byed pa ston to //
translated: This shows that at the proper time, without fatigue, he digests all the types of food.

original: de la zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs pa ni bza' ba dang btud ba dang bca' ba dang bldag pa dang gzhi ba pa'i dbye bas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs pa ni bza' ba dang btud ba dang bca' ba dang bldag pa dang gzhi ba pa'i dbye bas rig par bya'o //
translated: Therein, that which is eaten, drunk, chewed and tasted should be understood by the divisions of food, drink, chewables, suckables and lickables.

original: ci 'dod pa bzhin thob pa tshegs med par thob pa ngan ngon ma yin par thob pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa bzhin thob pa tshegs med par thob pa ngan ngon ma yin par thob pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: Obtaining what is desired, obtaining without difficulty, obtaining without deficiency, is a fragment of a s≈´tra.

original: ji srid 'dod pa dang nam 'dod pa dang / ji lta bu 'dod pa mngon sum du bya ba la dbang pa nyid kyi phyir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ji srid 'dod pa dang nam 'dod pa dang / ji lta bu 'dod pa mngon sum du bya ba la dbang pa nyid kyi phyir rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as the power to manifest whatever is desired, whenever it is desired, and in whatever way it is desired.

original: yun ring po dang / ring por mi thogs pa dang mchog tu byung ba rnams mngon sum du bya ba la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yun ring po dang / ring por mi thogs pa dang mchog tu byung ba rnams mngon sum du bya ba la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: because he has power over the manifestation of things that are distant, that are subtle, that are covered over, that are in the past, the future, and the very distant, and that are excellent.

original: tha chad ni ngan ngon zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha chad ni ngan ngon zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The inferior is the small.

original: gzhan dag na re tshegs dang nyams pa med pa nyid ngan ngon ma yin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshegs dang nyams pa med pa nyid ngan ngon ma yin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The small is that which is not free from difficulty and loss.

original: yid ches pa'i lung las ni //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung las ni //
translated: From a scripture of firm authority:

original: gang zhig rdzogs snyoms zhugs dang myur //
analyzed: gang zhig rdzogs snyoms zhugs dang myur //
translated: ‚ÄúHe who enters into perfect meditative concentration

original: bstan nyid de ni ci 'dod bzhin //

analyzed: bde ba nyid dang / nad med pa nyid dang / bdag dang bdag gi nyid du yang dag bar rjes su lta'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe five grasping heaps‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe five grasping heaps‚Äù is a summary verse.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang yang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang yang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The five grasping heaps are associated with the two characteristics of conditioned entities: origination and cessation.

original: rgyun gyis 'byung ba na gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gnas ba las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang yang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'byung ba na gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gnas ba las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang yang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are also associated with the third characteristic of conditioned entities, i.e., change, because they undergo a transformation of state through the process of continuance.

original: de dag mtshan nyid de ltar gnas pa yin pa na sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhi dang / lus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gzhi dang / rang bdag ma yin la bdag gzhan gyis kyang stong pa yin na /
analyzed: de dag mtshan nyid de ltar gnas pa yin pa na sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhi dang / lus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gzhi dang / rang bdag ma yin la bdag gzhan gyis kyang stong pa yin na /
translated: Even though they exist in this manner, they are the basis for the suffering of the mind and the basis for the suffering of the body. They are empty of self and of being owned by a self.

original: de la kun tu rmongs pa ni go rims bzhin du rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la kun tu rmongs pa ni go rims bzhin du rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúdelusion‚Äù should be understood as referring to the belief in permanence, etc., in relation to these heaps, in the order in which they are presented.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi gnod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhi nyid dang rang gi khams ma snyoms pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhi nyid du ma mthong na bde ba nyid dang nad med pa nyid du lta zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi gnod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhi nyid dang rang gi khams ma snyoms pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhi nyid du ma mthong na bde ba nyid dang nad med pa nyid du lta zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that the two views of pleasure and health are the two views of pleasure and health in regard to the very basis of the suffering of external injury and the very basis of the suffering of the internal imbalance of the elements.

original: de dag ni mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams kyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa rnams te /
analyzed: de dag ni mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams kyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa rnams te /
translated: In brief, these four views are the four errors of permanence, pleasure, purity, and self in regard to the impermanence, etc., of the five appropriative aggregates.

original: lta ba gnyis dang gnyis kyis yongs su bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis dang gnyis kyis yongs su bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that these four errors are taught by the two views of the self and things pertaining to the self.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir gtsang bar phyin ci log par ma smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir gtsang bar phyin ci log par ma smos so //
translated: Therefore, the error of purity is not mentioned here.

original: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba nyid dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
