original: de la tshul 'chos pa ni rnam pa gsum du rig bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshul 'chos pa ni rnam pa gsum du rig bar bya ste /
translated: Hypocrisy should be understood as threefold:

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa nyid kyis gzhan la yon tan yid ches bar bya ba'i bsam pas spyod lam legs par gnas pa dang / yul dben par gnas ba dang / rnyed pa khyad par can mi len pa nyid kyis dang / ngan pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa nyid kyis gzhan la yon tan yid ches bar bya ba'i bsam pas spyod lam legs par gnas pa dang / yul dben par gnas ba dang / rnyed pa khyad par can mi len pa nyid kyis dang / ngan pa dang /
translated: By the desire for gain and honor, one acts with a good demeanor, with the intention of convincing others of one's good qualities, one lives in a secluded place, and one does not accept special gains.

original: gya nom pa bsten pa dang mi bsten pa nyid kyis yo byad bsnyungs pa kun tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa bsten pa dang mi bsten pa nyid kyis yo byad bsnyungs pa kun tu ston pa'o //
translated: By not accepting the coarse and by accepting the refined, one shows off one's austerity.

original: kha gsag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: kha gsag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Flattery is also threefold:

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i bsam @76b pas rjes su mthun par snyan par smra ba dang / rang gi yon tan smra ba dang / chos smra ba'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i bsam @76b pas rjes su mthun par snyan par smra ba dang / rang gi yon tan smra ba dang / chos smra ba'o //
translated: By the desire for gain and honor, one speaks pleasantly in conformity with others, one speaks of one's own good qualities, and one speaks of the Dharma.

original: gzhogs slong kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhogs slong kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Hinting is also threefold:

original: rnyed pa'i bsam pas lus kyis gnod pa'i gzhi kun tu ston pa dang / phongs pa'i gzhi kun tu ston pa dang / tshig gis bsam pa'i gzhi bsngags par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i bsam pas lus kyis gnod pa'i gzhi kun tu ston pa dang / phongs pa'i gzhi kun tu ston pa dang / tshig gis bsam pa'i gzhi bsngags par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The basis of bodily harm is to show oneself as a basis of harm out of desire for gain. The basis of showing oneself as a basis of loss is to show oneself as a basis of loss out of desire for gain. The basis of praising oneself is to praise oneself out of desire for gain.

original: thob kyis 'jal ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: thob kyis 'jal ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of flattery:

original: rnyed pa'i bsam pas de la sbyin par mi byed pa la smod pa dang / gzhan la sbyin par byed pa la smod pa dang / ha cang phyi bzhin 'brang zhing smod pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i bsam pas de la sbyin par mi byed pa la smod pa dang / gzhan la sbyin par byed pa la smod pa dang / ha cang phyi bzhin 'brang zhing smod pa'o //
translated: The basis of flattery is to disparage one who does not give to oneself out of desire for gain. The basis of disparaging others is to disparage one who gives to others out of desire for gain. The basis of excessive following is to follow one who gives to others out of desire for gain.

original: rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of desire for gain through gain:

original: rnyed pa'i bsam pas gzhan las rnyed pa rgya che bar kun tu ston pa dang / sbyin par byed pa rgya che bar bsngags par byed pa dang / zang zing gi rnyed pa bsngags par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i bsam pas gzhan las rnyed pa rgya che bar kun tu ston pa dang / sbyin par byed pa rgya che bar bsngags par byed pa dang / zang zing gi rnyed pa bsngags par byed pa'o //
translated: The basis of showing off is to show off one‚Äôs own gain out of desire for gain. The basis of praising the giver is to praise the giver out of desire for gain. The basis of praising material gain is to praise material gain out of desire for gain.

original: 'di ni dge slong gi 'tsho ba log pa rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong gi 'tsho ba log pa rnam pa lnga yin te /
translated: These are the five kinds of wrong livelihood for a monk.

original: gcig ni lus kyis yin te /
analyzed: gcig ni lus kyis yin te /
translated: One is by way of the body.

original: gnyis pa ni ngag gis yin zhing /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ngag gis yin zhing /
translated: The second is by speech.

original: lhag ma rnams ni lus dang ngag gis yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni lus dang ngag gis yin no //
translated: The remaining ones are by body and speech.

original: tshig gang yin pa de dag ji ltar kha gsag ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gang yin pa de dag ji ltar kha gsag ma yin zhe na /
translated: How can the words of the Buddha be flattery?

original: gzhan mgu bar bya ba'i phyir smra ba 'dir kha gsag yin par dgongs kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //üîΩji mi'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la ri mo byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan mgu bar bya ba'i phyir smra ba 'dir kha gsag yin par dgongs kyi thams cad ni ma yin no // ji mi'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la ri mo byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba byed pa dang /
translated: The Buddha speaks in order to please others. He does not flatter in order to please.üîΩIn the world, there are those who respect their mother, their father, ascetics and brahmins, and the elders of the family.

original: bsod nams byed pa dang / 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa byed pa dang / bsod nams khyed pa dang / bsnyen gnas la nye bar gnas pa dang /
analyzed: bsod nams byed pa dang / 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa byed pa dang / bsod nams khyed pa dang / bsnyen gnas la nye bar gnas pa dang /
translated: There are those who do what is beneficial, who do what is right, who do meritorious actions, who fear the faults of this world and the next, who give gifts, who are zealous for merit, who observe the Uposadha.

original: tshul khrims yang dag bar blangs nas gnas pa'i mi dag mang ngam zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag bar blangs nas gnas pa'i mi dag mang ngam zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The passage, Are there many people who have taken up the morality and abide in it? is a portion of a s≈´tra.

original: de la ji ltar shes par bya ba lta bus mar shes pa ni mar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la ji ltar shes par bya ba lta bus mar shes pa ni mar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The phrase knowing her as one's mother means to hold her as one's mother.

original: de la gus par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gus par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because one should honor her.

original: mar 'dzin pa ji lta ba bzhin du phar 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mar 'dzin pa ji lta ba bzhin du phar 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as one holds one's mother, so one holds one's father.

original: dge sbyong rnams la ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / chos gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pas ri mo dang / sbyin par bya ba'i @77a * //
analyzed: dge sbyong rnams la ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / chos gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pas ri mo dang / sbyin par bya ba'i @77a * //
translated: One should stand up for, pay respect to, and bow down to the virtuous, and one should honor them with robes, alms, bowls, and so on, and give them service.

original: phyir legs par byed pa ni dge slong du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir legs par byed pa ni dge slong du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One should hold the virtuous as virtuous.

original: dge sbyong du 'dzin ba ji lta ba bzhin du bram zer 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong du 'dzin ba ji lta ba bzhin du bram zer 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as one holds the virtuous, so one holds the brƒÅhma·πáas.üîΩ One should honor the elders in one's family, one's older brothers, sisters, and so on, and one's relatives.

original: rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs phu nu bo dang / srid mo dang nye du rnams la bkur sti byed pa ni rgan rabs la ri mo byed pa ste//
analyzed: rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs phu nu bo dang / srid mo dang nye du rnams la bkur sti byed pa ni rgan rabs la ri mo byed pa ste//
translated: One should honor the elders.

original: ldang ba dang snyan bar smra ba la sogs pa bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldang ba dang snyan bar smra ba la sogs pa bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are engaged in the activities of rising up, speaking pleasantly, etc.

original: rgud pa rnams la rgud pa las yongs su bskyab pa dang / dgos pa bsgrub pa'i phyir don byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgud pa rnams la rgud pa las yongs su bskyab pa dang / dgos pa bsgrub pa'i phyir don byed pa'o //
translated: They are benefactors because they protect those in misfortune from misfortune and they accomplish their aims.

original: rang gi las la 'tsho ba log par ma yin pas legs par sbyor ba'i phyir bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi las la 'tsho ba log par ma yin pas legs par sbyor ba'i phyir bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: They are doers of what ought to be done because they are well-applied, not wrongly applied to their own work.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bsgrub pa'i phyir bsod nams byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bsgrub pa'i phyir bsod nams byed pa'o //
translated: They are makers of merit because they accomplish merit that arises from giving and morality.

original: 'di man chad ni rgyu gang gis de dag de ltar gyur pa dang ji ltar bsod nams byed pa rnams kyi rgyud dang rnam pa de 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni rgyu gang gis de dag de ltar gyur pa dang ji ltar bsod nams byed pa rnams kyi rgyud dang rnam pa de 'chad do //
translated: From here on, the text explains the causes by which they become that way and the way in which they make merit.

original: rgyu gang gis de de ltar gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis de de ltar gyur zhe na /
translated: By what causes do they become that way?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi kha na mtho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi kha na mtho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta bas so //
translated: Because they see fear in the misdeeds of this world and the next.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba ni 'phags pas smad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba ni 'phags pas smad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Misdeeds are what the noble ones condemn.

original: 'jigs pa ni nyes dmigs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni nyes dmigs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that fear is a disadvantage.

original: de las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is afraid of that.

original: ji ltar na bsod nams byed pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsod nams byed pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How are they meritorious?

original: zas dang skom dang bza' ba dang bca' ba dang bzhon pa dang gos la sogs pa sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zas dang skom dang bza' ba dang bca' ba dang bzhon pa dang gos la sogs pa sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: They are those who give food and drink, edibles and chewables, vehicles, clothing, etc.

original: de ni sbyin par bya bas na sbyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sbyin par bya bas na sbyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are givers because they give.

original: bsod nams byed pa ni kun dga' rab dang / nags tshal dang / stegs dang / rdzing dang / chu mig dang / bsod nams kyi khang pa la sogs pa bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten rjes su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams byed pa ni kun dga' rab dang / nags tshal dang / stegs dang / rdzing dang / chu mig dang / bsod nams kyi khang pa la sogs pa bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten rjes su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are meritorious because they help the world by building parks, groves, bridges, ponds, reservoirs, temples, etc.

original: 'di gnyis ka yang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka yang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin mod kyi /
translated: Both of these are the bases of the meritorious work consisting of giving.

original: tha dad par smos pa ni khyad par dang khyad par med par sbyin pa'i dbye bas yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par smos pa ni khyad par dang khyad par med par sbyin pa'i dbye bas yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But they are mentioned separately in order to demonstrate the classification of giving as distinct and indistinct.

original: khyad par du sbyin pa ni len pa po dga' zhig kho na la rang gir bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par du sbyin pa ni len pa po dga' zhig kho na la rang gir bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa gang yin ba'o //
translated: In particular, generosity is practiced in order to make oneself dear to the recipient.

original: khyad par med par sbyin pa ni sems can rnams la yongs su longs spyod du gzhug ba'i phyir byed ba med par gtong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med par sbyin pa ni sems can rnams la yongs su longs spyod du gzhug ba'i phyir byed ba med par gtong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Generosity without distinction is practiced in order to allow beings to enjoy.

original: bsnyen gnas la nye bar gnas pa dang / @77b tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas gnas pa ni nyin zhag gcig pa dang / ji srid 'tsho ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas la nye bar gnas pa dang / @77b tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas gnas pa ni nyin zhag gcig pa dang / ji srid 'tsho ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The observance of the fast is practiced in order to take up and observe morality for one day and one night or for as long as one lives.

original: mdor na mdo sde'i dum bu 'di ni mi rnams bla ma dang / yon gnas dang / rgan po rnams dang / rgud pa rnams dang / rang gi las dang / bsod nams byed pa la go rims bzhin du tshig gnyis dang gnyis dang bzhi rnams kyis ni re res yang dag bar bsgrub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor na mdo sde'i dum bu 'di ni mi rnams bla ma dang / yon gnas dang / rgan po rnams dang / rgud pa rnams dang / rang gi las dang / bsod nams byed pa la go rims bzhin du tshig gnyis dang gnyis dang bzhi rnams kyis ni re res yang dag bar bsgrub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, this passage from the sutra shows that these two verses, two by two, and four respectively teach the practice of the duties of the human being, the guru, the recipient of offerings, the elder, the unfortunate, one's own action, and the making of merit.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni yang dag par bsgrub bde nyid kyi rgyu dang / bsod nams bya ba'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni yang dag par bsgrub bde nyid kyi rgyu dang / bsod nams bya ba'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The rest of the passage shows the causes of the true establishment of merit and the classification of the aspects of meritorious action.

original: 'jig rten na chos smra ba ni su dag yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten na chos smra ba ni su dag yin /
translated: Who are the Dharma teachers in the world?

original: legs par zhugs pa ni su dag yin /
analyzed: legs par zhugs pa ni su dag yin /
translated: Who are the well-behaved?

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni su dag yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni su dag yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
translated: Who are the Well-Gone?

original: 'di ni 'jig rten na bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i bar ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten na bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i bar ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: This is a passage from a Sutra.

original: 'dir ni nges par legs pa las brtsams nas yang dag par smra ba dang / byed pa po gnyis dris pa dang / dris lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni nges par legs pa las brtsams nas yang dag par smra ba dang / byed pa po gnyis dris pa dang / dris lan btab pa yin no //
translated: Here, the question is asked about the two kinds of agents in relation to the highest good, and the answer is given.

original: byed pa po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: byed pa po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The agent is of two kinds:

original: brtson pa rnams ni gang dag yang dag par rab tu brtson pa rnams so //
analyzed: brtson pa rnams ni gang dag yang dag par rab tu brtson pa rnams so //
translated: those who are striving are those who are correctly striving;

original: grol ba rnams ni gang dag mthar phyir pa rnams so //
analyzed: grol ba rnams ni gang dag mthar phyir pa rnams so //
translated: those who are liberated are those who are at the end of the path.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams kho na smos pa ni de rnams kyi go rims bzhin du tshor ba gsum la bcings pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams kho na smos pa ni de rnams kyi go rims bzhin du tshor ba gsum la bcings pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reason for mentioning only attachment, aversion, and delusion is that they bind one to the three feelings, respectively.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus the Blessed One said: ‚ÄúAttachment increases in pleasant feeling.

original: sdug bsngal la ni khong khro ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la ni ma rig pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni khong khro ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la ni ma rig pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Aversion increases in painful feeling. Delusion increases in neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.‚Äù

original: gdul ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gdul ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro /
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of conversion‚Äù means for the sake of liberation.

original: ma lus par spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma lus par spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of complete abandonment‚Äù means for the sake of complete destruction.

original: gang su dag 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni sa las dang sa bon las dang / rnam pa las ma lus par spangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang su dag 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni sa las dang sa bon las dang / rnam pa las ma lus par spangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhoever completely abandons attachment‚Äù should be understood as complete abandonment from the standpoint of the stage, the seed, and the aspect.

original: sa las ji ltar zhe na srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du ji ltar rigs par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa las ji ltar zhe na srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du ji ltar rigs par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it from the standpoint of the stage? It is the abandonment of attachment up to the peak of existence, as is appropriate.

original: sa bon las ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon las ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it from the seed?

original: thog pa bag la nyal gyi mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog pa bag la nyal gyi mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seed is the characteristic of the latent state that is abandoned.

original: rnam pa las ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩmthong ba dang @78a * //
analyzed: rnam pa las ji lta bu zhe na / mthong ba dang @78a * //
translated: How is it from the aspect?

original: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa'i phyir dang / chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa'i rnams pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa'i phyir dang / chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa'i rnams pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the objects to be abandoned by seeing and by cultivation are abandoned, and because the aspects of the small of the small, etc., are abandoned.

original: yongs su shes bzhes bya ba la ji ltar yongs su shes she na /
analyzed: yongs su shes bzhes bya ba la ji ltar yongs su shes she na /
translated: How is it from complete knowledge?

original: bdag gis 'dod chags nas gti mug gi bar du spangs so zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: bdag gis 'dod chags nas gti mug gi bar du spangs so zhes bya bar ro //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúI have abandoned desire up to and including ignorance.‚Äù

original: spangs pas ni rnam par grol ba ston la /
analyzed: spangs pas ni rnam par grol ba ston la /
translated: Abandonment shows liberation.

original: yongs su shes pas ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pas ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
translated: Complete knowledge shows the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: de ltar na ma lus par spangs pa ni so sor rang gis rig par bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na ma lus par spangs pa ni so sor rang gis rig par bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it is taught that complete abandonment is only to be known personally,

original: gzhan la rag las pa dang / som nyi dang ldan pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa dang / som nyi dang ldan pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is dependent on others and because it is doubtful.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten na bde bar gshegs pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten na bde bar gshegs pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: The Fortunate Ones are so called in the world because they have gone to bliss.

original: zhes bya ba'i bde bar zhes bya ba 'di ni ma lus pa'i don la yang mthong ste /üîΩdper na zas bde bar zhu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bde bar zhes bya ba 'di ni ma lus pa'i don la yang mthong ste / dper na zas bde bar zhu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbliss‚Äù has a meaning that is complete,

original: bum pa legs par gang ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bum pa legs par gang ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: like ‚Äúfood is well cooked‚Äù or ‚Äúthe vase is full.‚Äù

original: bsngags pa'i don la yang mthong ste ;
analyzed: bsngags pa'i don la yang mthong ste ;
translated: It has a meaning of praise,

original: dper na gzugs bzang po cha lugs bzang bo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs bzang po cha lugs bzang bo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: like ‚Äúbeautiful form‚Äù or ‚Äúbeautiful costume.‚Äù

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i don la yang mthong ste /üîΩdper na gcin nad las bde bar thar ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i don la yang mthong ste / dper na gcin nad las bde bar thar ro //
translated: It has a meaning of non-return,

original: 'byung po'i gdon las bde bar thar ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i gdon las bde bar thar ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: like ‚Äúfreed from the disease of diabetes‚Äù or ‚Äúfreed from the demon of the elements.‚Äù

original: don rnam pa 'di gsum gyis bde bar gshegs pa dag yin te /
analyzed: don rnam pa 'di gsum gyis bde bar gshegs pa dag yin te /
translated: The Fortunate Ones are so called because of these three meanings:

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag las bzlog nas ji srid du bgrod par bya bar gshegs pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba bzang por gshegs pa'i phyir dang / phyir mi ldog par gshegs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag las bzlog nas ji srid du bgrod par bya bar gshegs pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba bzang por gshegs pa'i phyir dang / phyir mi ldog par gshegs pa'i phyir te /
translated: they have gone to bliss by turning away from mundane meditative attainments; they have gone to a good destination; and they have gone without returning.

original: mya ngan las 'das par gshegs pa dag ni de ltar du gshegs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gshegs pa dag ni de ltar du gshegs pa dag yin no //
translated: Thus, those who have attained nirvana have attained it.

original: de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa ni bla na med pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid du bstan pa yin te go rims bzhin no /
analyzed: de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa ni bla na med pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid du bstan pa yin te go rims bzhin no /
translated: Thus, nirvana is taught to be unsurpassed and eternal, respectively.

original: // / bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga pa /
translated: Here is a passage from a sutra:

original: 'di ltar las kyang yod la nyon mongs pa rnams dang sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa yang yod na de lta bu ni tshe phyi ma la 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar las kyang yod la nyon mongs pa rnams dang sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa yang yod na de lta bu ni tshe phyi ma la 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf karma exists, and if the afflictions, craving, views, pride, and ignorance exist, then in that case, formations will arise in a future life.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni skye ba'i rgyu grogs dang bcas pa yongs su bstan pa yin no //üîΩlas la nyon mongs pa rnams grogs su gyur pas skye ba skyed par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir ni skye ba'i rgyu grogs dang bcas pa yongs su bstan pa yin no // las la nyon mongs pa rnams grogs su gyur pas skye ba skyed par byed de /
translated: Here, the cause of birth is taught along with its conditions.üîΩThe afflictions assist karma in generating birth,

original: nyon mongs pa zad na mi @78b skye ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa ma zad na las ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad na mi @78b skye ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa ma zad na las ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the afflictions are exhausted, there is no birth, and because when the afflictions are not exhausted, karma generates birth as appropriate.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag kyang sred pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag kyang sred pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions are craving and so on.

original: de la sred pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩmdo sde gzhan las ni skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la sred pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no // mdo sde gzhan las ni skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Craving is the cause of actualization.üîΩIn another sutra, it is said that craving is the cause of birth.

original: sred pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In another sutra, it is said that craving is the cause of actualization.

original: ji ltar na sred pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sred pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: How is craving the cause of actualization?

original: lus thams cad kyi thun mong gi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis mngon par 'grub ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus thams cad kyi thun mong gi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis mngon par 'grub ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of actualization because it is the cause of the body in common with all.

original: lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa ni de 'dren par byed pa dag yin te /
analyzed: lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa ni de 'dren par byed pa dag yin te /
translated: The views, pride, and ignorance are the causes of its guidance.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi sgo nas bdag med pa nyid la kun tu rmongs na de kun tu rgyu ba dang mi spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi sgo nas bdag med pa nyid la kun tu rmongs na de kun tu rgyu ba dang mi spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one is confused about selflessness through the view of self and the pride of ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù then one is guided by craving and the others.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag kho na smos kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag kho na smos kyi /
translated: Therefore, only these are mentioned,

original: khong khro ba dang the tshom gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba dang the tshom gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not aversion and doubt.

original: gzhan yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi las kyi grogs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi las kyi grogs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad yin la /
translated: Moreover, all the afflictions are the assistants of karma in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gnyis kyi ni sred pa la sogs pa grogs yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gnyis kyi ni sred pa la sogs pa grogs yin te /
translated: In the two higher realms, craving and so on are assistants because

original: sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan gyi bag la nyal yod ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan gyi bag la nyal yod ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the latent states of meditative stabilization are dominated by craving, view, pride and doubt.

original: the tshom ni ma rig pas rab tu phye ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: the tshom ni ma rig pas rab tu phye ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Doubt is classified by ignorance because

original: gti mug shas che ba la shes pa nges pa mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gti mug shas che ba la shes pa nges pa mi 'byung bas so //
translated: knowledge is not ascertained in those with delusion.

original: dge slong dag dge slong gsar bu 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi gnod pas gtses pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong gsar bu 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi gnod pas gtses pa /
translated: Monks, these new monks are afflicted by the harm of asceticism,

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dam gyis zil gyis non pa /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dam gyis zil gyis non pa /
translated: overwhelmed by the mud of pure conduct,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang srid pa pa rims nad dang bcas pa sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur pa rnams kyis zil gyis non pa zhes bya
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang srid pa pa rims nad dang bcas pa sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur pa rnams kyis zil gyis non pa zhes bya
translated: The evil, nonvirtuous, defiled dharmas, which are the cause of rebirth, along with the disease of craving, and which have the nature of suffering, are overwhelming.

original: ba'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: ba'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: This is a passage from a Sutra.

original: de la dge sbyong gi gnod pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti gang gis zil gyis non na dge sbyong gi dngos po las nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de la dge sbyong gi gnod pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti gang gis zil gyis non na dge sbyong gi dngos po las nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The harm of the religious life is that gain and honor overwhelm one and cause one to fall from the state of a religious person.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'di ltar 'di na kha cig bslab pa btang nas nyams te gnas pa 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba las nyams pa yin no zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'di ltar 'di na kha cig bslab pa btang nas nyams te gnas pa 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba las nyams pa yin no zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúMonks, when someone gives up the training and falls into transgression, that is a falling away from the holy life.‚Äù

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dam ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti gang la chags na 'phags @79a * //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dam ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti gang la chags na 'phags @79a * //
translated: The mire of pure conduct is that gain and honor, when one is attached to them, cause one to fall into the mud of desire.

original: pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par mi 'dong ba ste /
analyzed: pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par mi 'dong ba ste /
translated: They do not go to the path of the eightfold noble path which leads to nirvana.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dam yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dam yin par gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has said that this is the mire of pure conduct.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa ste /
translated: Evil, unwholesome dharmas are those which are defiled,

original: gang dag gis zil gyis non na tshul khrims nyams par byas nas ngan song du 'dod ba rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyu brnab sems can nyid la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis zil gyis non na tshul khrims nyams par byas nas ngan song du 'dod ba rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyu brnab sems can nyid la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: and by which one is overcome, and having violated morality, one finds pleasure in the miserable destinies.

original: 'dis ni dge slong gsar bu rnyed pa dang bkur sti lhur len 'dzin pa rnams la mthong ba'i chos la bslab pa gtong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro ba dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i nyes dmigs rnam pa gsum yod par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dge slong gsar bu rnyed pa dang bkur sti lhur len 'dzin pa rnams la mthong ba'i chos la bslab pa gtong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro ba dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i nyes dmigs rnam pa gsum yod par ston to //
translated: This shows the three disadvantages for the newly ordained monk who is intent on gain and honor: he abandons the training in this very life, he does not go to nirvana, and in the next life he goes to the miserable destinies.

original: de la sdig pa ni 'phags pa'i skye bos smod pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de la sdig pa ni 'phags pa'i skye bos smod pa'i don gyis so //
translated: There, evil means that which is censured by the noble ones.

original: mi dge ba ni mi bde ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni mi bde ba'i don gyis so //
translated: Non-virtue is so called because it is the cause of unhappiness.

original: de ltar na de rnams ni gzhan gyis dang / rang nyid kyis skyon yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de rnams ni gzhan gyis dang / rang nyid kyis skyon yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they are taught to be faults in terms of others and in terms of oneself.

original: ji ltar smad pa dang mi bde ba de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang srid pa pa nyid ba nyes dmigs dang bcas pas yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar smad pa dang mi bde ba de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang srid pa pa nyid ba nyes dmigs dang bcas pas yang dag par ston to //
translated: The S≈´tra teaches that they are afflicted, that they are the cause of future rebirth, and that they have a negative result, because they are reproachable and because they are the cause of unhappiness.

original: de ni mthong ba'i chos la yang dang yang du kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i chos la yang dang yang du kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: They are afflicted because they repeatedly afflict one in this life.

original: tshe phyi ma la yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir yang srid pa pa'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir yang srid pa pa'o //
translated: They are the cause of future rebirth because they establish rebirth in a future life.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can dag yin pa la rims nad dang bcas pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can gyi nyes dmigs yod de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can dag yin pa la rims nad dang bcas pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can gyi nyes dmigs yod de /
translated: They have a negative result because they have a result that is suffering.

original: mthong ba'i chos nyid la nyon mongs pa yongs su gdung ba rnams kyis lus dang sems yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i phyir dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la nyon mongs pa yongs su gdung ba rnams kyis lus dang sems yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i phyir dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they torment the body and mind with the burning of the defilements in this very life, and because they lead to rebirth in the unfortunate planes of existence in the next life.

original: yang srid pa par gyur pa la tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i nyes dmigs yod de yun ring por skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba 'dren ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang srid pa par gyur pa la tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i nyes dmigs yod de yun ring por skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba 'dren ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And for those who have taken rebirth, there is the misfortune of birth, old age, and death in the next life, because they lead to birth, old age, and death for a long time.

original: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed pa dang / mi gtong bar bsgom pa dang / lhag mthong dang ldan pa khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa /
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed pa dang / mi gtong bar bsgom pa dang / lhag mthong dang ldan pa khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa /
translated: This is the practice of the teaching of the Master, the cultivation of non-abandonment, the filling of empty houses with insight,

original: rang gi don gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa /
translated: the application to one's own goal,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa @79b mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa @79b mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa /
translated: the non-condemnation by wise companions in the celibate life,

original: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: and the fruitful enjoyment of the alms of the country. This is the section of the sutra.

original: de la bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed ba'o //
analyzed: de la bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed ba'o //
translated: In order to practice in accordance with the teaching, one practices in accordance with the teaching of the Master.

original: yang dang yang du bsgoms pas mi gtong bar sgom pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar cung zad cung zad ces bya ba gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bsgoms pas mi gtong bar sgom pa ste / 'di ltar cung zad cung zad ces bya ba gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: In order to cultivate without abandoning through repeated cultivation, one cultivates without abandoning.

original: ji ltar thos pa bzhin du chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i phyir lhag mthong dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa bzhin du chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i phyir lhag mthong dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In order to cultivate with insight, one cultivates with insight.üîΩIn order to cultivate with a one-pointed mind, one cultivates with a one-pointed mind.üîΩIn order to cultivate with a mind free from desire, one cultivates with a mind free from desire.

original: sems rtse gcig tu bya ba'i don du khyim stong pa rnams la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa'o //üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa ni legs par rab tu byung ba'i rang gi don yin te /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu bya ba'i don du khyim stong pa rnams la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa'o // mya ngan las 'das pa ni legs par rab tu byung ba'i rang gi don yin te /
translated: In order to cultivate with a mind free from anger, one cultivates with a mind free from anger.üîΩIn order to cultivate with a mind free from delusion, one cultivates with a mind free from delusion.

original: de'i don du rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don du rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to cultivate with a mind free from fear, one cultivates with a mind free from fear.üîΩIn order to cultivate with a mind free from distraction, one cultivates with a mind free from distraction.üîΩIn order to cultivate with a mind free from defilements, one cultivates with a mind free from defilements.üîΩIn order to cultivate with a mind free from afflictions, one cultivates with a mind free from afflictions.üîΩIn order to cultivate with a mind free from pride, one cultivates with a mind free from pride.üîΩIn order to cultivate with a mind free from arrogance, one cultivates with a mind free from arrogance.üîΩIn order to cultivate with a mind free from conceit, one cultivates with a mind free from conceit.

original: de'i sbyor ba ni thabs yin te /üîΩde thob bar byed pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni thabs yin te /üîΩde thob bar byed pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: In order to cultivate with a mind free from attachment, one cultivates with a mind free from attachment.

original: de la rjes su brtson pa ni ji ltar de la brtson par bya bde ltar brtson 'grus mi gtong ba nyid kyis brtson pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la rjes su brtson pa ni ji ltar de la brtson par bya bde ltar brtson 'grus mi gtong ba nyid kyis brtson pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is diligent in the practice of the latter, because he is diligent in the practice of the former, i.e. he does not abandon his effort.

original: de ltar na rang gi don gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi don gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa'o //
translated: Thus, he is diligent in the practice of his own aim.

original: mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'o //
translated: He is not censured by the wise, i.e. by his fellow brahmacarins, because he is truly desirous.

original: de'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par za ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par za ba'o //
translated: He eats the alms of the country with their fruit, because he makes them fruitful.

original: mdor na tshig bdun po 'di rnams kyis ni ston pa dang / bstan pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang / sbyin par byed pa rnams la yang dag par sgrub pa yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor na tshig bdun po 'di rnams kyis ni ston pa dang / bstan pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang / sbyin par byed pa rnams la yang dag par sgrub pa yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, these seven terms indicate the accomplishment of the teacher, the teaching, the fellow brahmacarins, and the benefactors.

original: ston pa la ni de'i bstan pa bzhin du sgrub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa la ni de'i bstan pa bzhin du sgrub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The teacher is accomplished because he teaches the Dharma as it is.

original: bstan pa la na rtag tu las khyad par du 'phags pa la sbyor ba'i phyir dang / phyin ci ma log par sbyor ba'i phyir dang / rnam par ma g-yengs par sbyor ba'i phyir dang / chog mi shes par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa la na rtag tu las khyad par du 'phags pa la sbyor ba'i phyir dang / phyin ci ma log par sbyor ba'i phyir dang / rnam par ma g-yengs par sbyor ba'i phyir dang / chog mi shes par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they always apply themselves to the most excellent action in the teaching, because they apply themselves without error, because they apply themselves without distraction, and because they apply themselves without complacency.

original: dge slong gi las khyad par du 'phags pa ni bsam gtan yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi las khyad par du 'phags pa ni bsam gtan yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the most excellent action of a monk is meditation.

original: gzhan yang rtag tu bsgom pa'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par bsgom pa'i phyir dang / bar chad med par bsgom pa'i phyir dang / chog mi shes par bsgom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa @80a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag tu bsgom pa'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par bsgom pa'i phyir dang / bar chad med par bsgom pa'i phyir dang / chog mi shes par bsgom pa'i phyir ro // tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa @80a * //
translated: Moreover, it is because they always meditate, because they meditate without affliction, because they meditate without interruption, and because they meditate without complacency.

original: rnams la ni don mthun pa nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnams la ni don mthun pa nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They apply themselves to the welfare of their companions in the celibate life.

original: sbyin par byed pa rnams la ni de'i sbyin pa 'bras bu chen po nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa rnams la ni de'i sbyin pa 'bras bu chen po nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They apply themselves to the great result of the generosity of those who give.

original: da ltar mi rnams ni chos ma yin par chags pas chags pa dang / mi rigs par chags pas zil gyis non pa dang / chos log pas dkris pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: da ltar mi rnams ni chos ma yin par chags pas chags pa dang / mi rigs par chags pas zil gyis non pa dang / chos log pas dkris pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The following is a summary of the above: People are attached to what is contrary to Dharma, overcome by attachment to what is improper, and entangled by attachment to false Dharma.

original: de la chos ma yin pas yul yongs su spyad pa la chags pa ni chos ma yin par chags pas chags pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos ma yin pas yul yongs su spyad pa la chags pa ni chos ma yin par chags pas chags pa ste /
translated: Attachment to the enjoyment of objects that are contrary to Dharma is attachment to what is contrary to Dharma.

original: dper na 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'am lings 'debs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'am lings 'debs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, sexual misconduct and robbery.

original: mi rigs pas chags pa ni mi rigs par chags pa ste /
analyzed: mi rigs pas chags pa ni mi rigs par chags pa ste /
translated: Attachment to what is improper is attachment to what is improper.

original: chom rkun dang / mthu stobs dang / brid pa la sogs pas pha rol gyi nor don du gnyer ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chom rkun dang / mthu stobs dang / brid pa la sogs pas pha rol gyi nor don du gnyer ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the pursuit of another's wealth by means of theft, force, deception, and so on.

original: log pas byas pa'i chos ni log pa'i chos te /
analyzed: log pas byas pa'i chos ni log pa'i chos te /
translated: Falsely created Dharma is false Dharma.

original: 'di chos ma yin par byas pa pha rol la 'tshe ba dang ldan pa rgyal po'i chos sam bram ze'i chos gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di chos ma yin par byas pa pha rol la 'tshe ba dang ldan pa rgyal po'i chos sam bram ze'i chos gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the Dharma of kings or Brahmins that is contrary to Dharma and is harmful to others.

original: des ni yul yongs su spyad pa dang / longs spyod yongs su tshol ba dang / bde 'gro yongs su tshol ba la brtsams nas mi rnams la log par sgrub pa rnam pa gsum yod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni yul yongs su spyad pa dang / longs spyod yongs su tshol ba dang / bde 'gro yongs su tshol ba la brtsams nas mi rnams la log par sgrub pa rnam pa gsum yod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that there are three kinds of wrong practice for people, beginning with the complete enjoyment of objects, the complete enjoyment of pleasures, and the complete enjoyment of good destinies.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gtam dus sngar bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gtam dus sngar bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The discourse of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is to be undertaken at the proper time.

original: sbyin pa'i gtam dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The discourse is on giving, morality, heaven,

original: de la dus sngar bya ba ni rgyud yang dag phul can gyi gtam gyi snod du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dus sngar bya ba ni rgyud yang dag phul can gyi gtam gyi snod du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The proper time is for the sake of making a person a vessel for the discourse on the highest, pure stream.

original: de ni mdor na longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu dang / lus phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu dang / phun sum tshogs pa di gnyis ka'i khyad par dang / de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i gzhi dang / de las des par 'byung ba'i thabs las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mdor na longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu dang / lus phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu dang / phun sum tshogs pa di gnyis ka'i khyad par dang / de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i gzhi dang / de las des par 'byung ba'i thabs las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, it is to be understood as beginning with the cause of the perfection of wealth, the cause of the perfection of body, the distinction of these two perfections, the basis for turning away from them, and the means of emancipation from them.

original: de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i gzhi ni 'dod pa rnams ro chung ba nyid dang / nyes dmigs mang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i gzhi ni 'dod pa rnams ro chung ba nyid dang / nyes dmigs mang ba nyid yin no //
translated: The basis for turning away from that is the small taste of desires and their many disadvantages.

original: de gnyis kyis kyang 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar byed do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis kyang 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar byed do //
translated: By means of those two, one becomes afflicted and purified.

original: de las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs ni rab tu 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid des par 'byung ba nyid dang / rab tu byung @80b nas lus dang sems thag ring ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu dben pa nyid dang / rab tu dben par gyur nas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs ni rab tu 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid des par 'byung ba nyid dang / rab tu byung @80b nas lus dang sems thag ring ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu dben pa nyid dang / rab tu dben par gyur nas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The means of deliverance from that is renunciation, which is characterized by going forth; and after going forth, seclusion, which is characterized by the distance between body and mind; and after becoming secluded, the factors conducive to purification, which are characterized by the accumulation of nirvana, such as the foundations of mindfulness.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gtam rnams kyi go rims ni mi rnams kyi bde ba ni longs spyod la rag las pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gtam rnams kyi go rims ni mi rnams kyi bde ba ni longs spyod la rag las pa yin la /
translated: The order of the teachings on generosity and so on is as follows: The happiness of humans depends on resources.

original: longs spyod chen po yang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod chen po yang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Great wealth is also the result of generosity.

original: de'i phyir de rnams ni sbyin pa'i gtam kho na la dga' ba yin pas thog ma kho nar sbyin pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams ni sbyin pa'i gtam kho na la dga' ba yin pas thog ma kho nar sbyin pa'i gtam mo //
translated: Therefore, they delight in the very topic of generosity.

original: sbyin pa de yang tshul khrims med na ngan 'gror 'bras bu smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa de yang tshul khrims med na ngan 'gror 'bras bu smin par 'gyur te /
translated: That generosity, if not endowed with morality, ripens as a result in miserable realms.

original: gro zhin skyes kyi mdo las /
analyzed: gro zhin skyes kyi mdo las /
translated: As the S≈´tra on the Wise and Foolish says,üîΩ‚ÄúEven if you become an elephant, you will obtain the ornaments of an elephant.‚Äù

original: glang po cher gyur kyang glang po che rgyan dang ldan pa thob pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin pas de'i 'og tu tshul khrims kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: glang po cher gyur kyang glang po che rgyan dang ldan pa thob pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin pas de'i 'og tu tshul khrims kyi gtam mo //
translated: Therefore, after that, the topic of morality.

original: de'i 'og tu bde 'gror gyur du zin gyis kyang mi rnams kyis 'dod par bya ba dag ni mi gtsang ba dang / dri nga ba dang / dri bshung ba dang / mi mthun pa dag yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bde 'gror gyur du zin gyis kyang mi rnams kyis 'dod par bya ba dag ni mi gtsang ba dang / dri nga ba dang / dri bshung ba dang / mi mthun pa dag yin la /
translated: After that, even if you become a god or human, the objects of desire are impure, foul-smelling, disgusting, and unpleasant.

original: lha rnams kyi 'dod par bya ba dag ni 'phags par ches lhag pa dang ches gya nom pa yin no zhes mtho ris kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi 'dod par bya ba dag ni 'phags par ches lhag pa dang ches gya nom pa yin no zhes mtho ris kyi gtam mo //
translated: The objects of desire of the gods are far superior and much more refined than those of humans.

original: de'i 'og tu de rnams la ro chung ba dang / nyes dmigs ches mang ba yin no zhes 'dod pa rnams la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yin no //üîΩde'i 'og tu ro myang ba las gyur pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de rnams la ro chung ba dang / nyes dmigs ches mang ba yin no zhes 'dod pa rnams la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yin no // de'i 'og tu ro myang ba las gyur pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin la /
translated: Then, after that, he teaches the enjoyment of those and the many dangers in them, in order to show the enjoyment and the many dangers in them.

original: nyes dmigs las gyur pa ni rnam par byang ba yin no zhes kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes dmigs las gyur pa ni rnam par byang ba yin no zhes kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Then, after that, he teaches the defilement that arises from enjoyment and the purification that arises from the dangers, in order to show the defilement and the purification.

original: de'i 'og tu nyes dmigs kyis yid byung na de las nges par 'byung ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa yin no zhes nges par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i phan yon la sogs pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyes dmigs kyis yid byung na de las nges par 'byung ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa yin no zhes nges par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i phan yon la sogs pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Then, after that, he teaches the benefit of renunciation and isolation, in order to show that when one is disgusted with the dangers, one turns toward renunciation.

original: gang gi tshe sems rangs pa dang sems nyams bde ba zhes bya ba ni gtam 'di'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems rangs pa dang sems nyams bde ba zhes bya ba ni gtam 'di'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: When it is said that ‚Äúthe mind becomes clear and the body becomes tranquil,‚Äù this shows the benefit of this discourse.

original: sems dga' ba dang sems sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sems rangs pa dang / nyams bde ba'i bshad pa yin par go rims bzhin te /üîΩmchog tu dga' ba nyid @81a * //
analyzed: sems dga' ba dang sems sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sems rangs pa dang / nyams bde ba'i bshad pa yin par go rims bzhin te / mchog tu dga' ba nyid @81a * //
translated: The mind is delighted and the mind is free from obscurations means that the mind is satisfied and the mind is comfortable, respectively.

original: dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa lnga dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa lnga dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is endowed with supreme delight and because it is not endowed with the five obscurations.

original: skyon med par ni nyams bde ba zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: skyon med par ni nyams bde ba zhes bya bas so //
translated: The mind is comfortable because it is free from faults.

original: yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa kun tu shes par bya bar skal ba dang ldan pa dang nus pa zhes bya ba ni sems de'i phan yon yongs su ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa kun tu shes par bya bar skal ba dang ldan pa dang nus pa zhes bya ba ni sems de'i phan yon yongs su ston pa yin no //
translated: The mind is capable of understanding and comprehending the teaching of the supreme Dharma means that this shows the benefits of that mind.

original: de la sems dga' ba nyid kyis ni skal ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sems dga' ba nyid kyis ni skal ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the mind is capable because it is delighted.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rim pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rim pas so //
translated: Because it is the cause of delight, etc.

original: sems sgrib pa med pa nyid kyis ni nus pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: sems sgrib pa med pa nyid kyis ni nus pa kho na yin te /
translated: The mind is capable because it is free from obscurations.

original: sgrib pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it obtains the concentration that is the antidote to the afflictions, which are the obscurations.

original: gzhan yang skal ba dang ldan pa dang / nus pa gnyis kyis ni rigs dang / yongs su smin pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang skal ba dang ldan pa dang / nus pa gnyis kyis ni rigs dang / yongs su smin pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the possession of good fortune and the possession of ability should be understood as the teaching of the perfection of the spiritual gene and the perfection of complete maturity, respectively.

original: de'i tshe na de la gnyis ka phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na de la gnyis ka phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: At that time, both are perfect.

original: rigs ni snga nas yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rigs ni snga nas yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The spiritual gene is present from the beginning.

original: rigs ma smos na sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa ni gnyis ka la ltos pa'o zhes bstan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs ma smos na sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa ni gnyis ka la ltos pa'o zhes bstan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the spiritual gene were not mentioned, it would not be taught that the teaching of the true doctrine by the Buddhas depends on both.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam ni yang dag phul can te //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam ni yang dag phul can te //
translated: The discourse on the noble truths is the true doctrine,

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba las yang dag phul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba las yang dag phul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the paths of insight and cultivation are the true doctrine, since they cause one to transcend evil destinies and cyclic existence.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang chos thams cad las mchog tu 'phags pa nyid kyis yang dag phul can yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang chos thams cad las mchog tu 'phags pa nyid kyis yang dag phul can yin no //
translated: Nirvana is the true doctrine, since it is the most excellent of all things.

original: 'bras bu de dang ldan pa'i phyir yang dag phul can te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de dang ldan pa'i phyir yang dag phul can te /
translated: The result is the true doctrine, since it is endowed with that.

original: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa bzhin no //
translated: and the craving for future existence.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas de ltar mthong na gzugs la yid 'byung bar 'gyur zhing tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas de ltar mthong na gzugs la yid 'byung bar 'gyur zhing tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the noble disciple who has heard much sees in this way, he becomes disgusted with form, he becomes disgusted with feeling, with perception, with volitional formations, and with consciousness.

original: yid byung na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid byung na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is disgusted, he becomes detached.üîΩWhen he is detached, he is liberated.

original: 'dod chags dang bral na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o//
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o//
translated: This is a passage from a Sutra.

original: 'dir yid byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur ba ni go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yid byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur ba ni go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the causes of disgust, detachment, and liberation are respectively demonstrated.

original: de la yid byung ba ni mi mthun pa nyid du 'dzin pa'o //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa ni /üîΩ'dod chags dang bral @81b ba ste /
analyzed: de la yid byung ba ni mi mthun pa nyid du 'dzin pa'o // 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa ni / 'dod chags dang bral @81b ba ste /
translated: Disgust is the apprehension of the disagreeable.üîΩDetachment is the absence of craving.

original: de'i thob pa 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thob pa 'chad pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the cessation of the possession of that.

original: de'i thob pa la sogs pa dang de dang mi ldan par gnas gyur ba ni rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de'i thob pa la sogs pa dang de dang mi ldan par gnas gyur ba ni rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: and the attainment of that and so on, and the state of abiding without that is liberation.

original: tshangs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu nyid kyis kyang yin te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu nyid kyis kyang yin te /
translated: They are also the causes of the three pure actions.

original: tshangs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni spong ba yang dag par len pa dang / de bar skabs su spong ba dang / de gtan du spong ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni spong ba yang dag par len pa dang / de bar skabs su spong ba dang / de gtan du spong ba'o //
translated: The three pure actions are the pure action of taking up the abandonment, the pure action of abandoning in the interval, and the pure action of abandoning forever.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen pos kyang yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen pos kyang yin te /
translated: It is also the antidote to the three kinds of defilement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni sdig pa byed pa rnams kyi nyes par spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa can rnams kyi sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni sdig pa byed pa rnams kyi nyes par spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa can rnams kyi sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of defilement are: the defilement of bad conduct in those who commit evil deeds; the defilement of craving in those who are attached to the desires other than those of the bad states; and the defilement of views in the heterodox.

original: ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i gnyen pos kyang yin no //
analyzed: ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i gnyen pos kyang yin no //
translated: It is also the antidote to the bad destinies and to the good destinies with their injuries and without injuries.

original: de la ngan 'gro ni ngan song rnams yin no //
analyzed: de la ngan 'gro ni ngan song rnams yin no //
translated: The bad destinies are the bad states.

original: bde 'gro gnod pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang mi rnams so //
analyzed: bde 'gro gnod pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang mi rnams so //
translated: The good destinies with injuries are the gods and humans who experience the desires.

original: gnod pa med pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams so //
translated: The good destinies without injuries are the gods who experience the form and formless realms.

original: las nag po dang / 'dren ma dang dkar po'i gnyen pos kyang yin te nag po ni sems can dmyal bar smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: las nag po dang / 'dren ma dang dkar po'i gnyen pos kyang yin te nag po ni sems can dmyal bar smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is also the antidote to black, mixed, and white karma. Black karma ripens in the hells.

original: 'dren ma ni de las gzhan pa'i 'dod khams su rnam par smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dren ma ni de las gzhan pa'i 'dod khams su rnam par smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: Mixed karma ripens in the desire realm other than the hells.

original: dkar po ni gzugs dang gzugs med par rnam par smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dkar po ni gzugs dang gzugs med par rnam par smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: White karma ripens in the form and formless realms.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gsum gyis gnyen pos kyang yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gsum gyis gnyen pos kyang yin te /
translated: It is also the antidote to the three occasions of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gsum ni zil gyis gnon pa'i gnas skabs dang / kun nas rgyu ba'i gnas skabs dang / bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs @85b so ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gsum ni zil gyis gnon pa'i gnas skabs dang / kun nas rgyu ba'i gnas skabs dang / bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs @85b so ;
translated: The three occasions of affliction are the occasion of being overwhelmed, the occasion of being completely bound, and the occasion of latency.

original: / de'i gnyen po nyid ni dug gi ljon shing rabs bskor ba dang bcad pa dang dbyung ba'i tshul gyis yin no //
analyzed: / de'i gnyen po nyid ni dug gi ljon shing rabs bskor ba dang bcad pa dang dbyung ba'i tshul gyis yin no //

original: sdig pa dang 'dod pa dang drag po spyod pa'i gnyen pos kyang yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa dang 'dod pa dang drag po spyod pa'i gnyen pos kyang yin te /
translated: It is also the antidote to the conduct of sin, desire, and violence.

original: rab tu byung bas mtha' gnyis la bsnyen par mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung bas mtha' gnyis la bsnyen par mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //

original: bde 'gro dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid kyis kyang yin no //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid kyis kyang yin no //
translated: It is also the cause of happy rebirth, of mundane purity, and of supramundane purity.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i rten nyid kyis kyang yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i rten nyid kyis kyang yin no //
translated: It is also the basis of meditative concentration, wisdom, and liberation.

original: gnyis 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid dang mnyam par 'jog pa dang / rnam par grol bar byed pas kyang yin te /
analyzed: gnyis 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid dang mnyam par 'jog pa dang / rnam par grol bar byed pas kyang yin te /
translated: It is also the cause of the arising of the two, because it causes the mind to enter into meditative concentration and to be liberated.

original: gcig gis ni gnyis skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin la /
analyzed: gcig gis ni gnyis skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin la /
translated: By the first, the cause of the arising of the two is stated.

original: gnyis pas ni sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog par byed pa yin zhing gsum pas ni sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par grol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog par byed pa yin zhing gsum pas ni sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par grol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: By the second, the mind that is not concentrated is caused to enter into meditative concentration. By the third, the mind that is concentrated is caused to be liberated.

original: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: The concluding verse:

original: sdom brtson tshangs spyod kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: sdom brtson tshangs spyod kun nyon mongs //

analyzed: 'gro dang las rnam gsum phyir dang // nyon mongs skabs dang spyod dang dag / rten dang byed rnam gsum phyir ro //
translated: Because of the support and the three actions.

original: mtshams sbyar ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: mtshams sbyar ba bshad zin to /

original: // / brgal ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / brgal ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: sgra la brgal pa dang / don la brgal ba'o //
analyzed: sgra la brgal pa dang / don la brgal ba'o //
translated: an objection to the words and an objection to the meaning.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bzhugs zin kyang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bzhugs zin kyang /
translated: the venerable ≈öƒÅriputra is already seated,

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu khyod da gzod dang gang nas 'ong 'ong /
translated: but it is said, ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, you have come now. Where did you come from?‚Äù

original: btsun pa da gzod thibs po'i tshal nas gdugs la mchis pa las mchi mchi'o zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di ni da ltar byung ba bzhin du 'das pa'i dus la bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa da gzod thibs po'i tshal nas gdugs la mchis pa las mchi mchi'o zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di ni da ltar byung ba bzhin du 'das pa'i dus la bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: pa'i bya ba ni 'ga' yang med do //

analyzed: de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /

translated: Similarly, whatever form there is,

analyzed: de thams cad ni tshor ba'i tshogs drug go zhes ni ma gsung la /

analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis rnams las bcu char dang bcu gcig pa'i phyogs kyang gzugs yin bzhin du gcig pu zhig gzugs kyi skye mched du gsungs pa yang mtshan nyid 'dra ba la dgos pa med par bye brag tu bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin

original: no // sgra la brgal ba ni rnam pa de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: no // sgra la brgal ba ni rnam pa de lta bu yin no //

translated: That which is called consciousness arises, and as those nights and days pass, those seconds, minutes, and hours pass, many different kinds arise and arise,üîΩand many different kinds cease and cease.‚Äù

analyzed: gzhan 'gag cing 'gag go zhes bya ba gsungs pa dang / kha cig las yang 'di skad du sems zhes bya ba'am /

translated: If it is from a collection, then it follows that all four primary elements would be perceived in all collections of form, but solidity is not perceived in light, nor fluidity in fire.

original: @87a * // ji ltar med de /
analyzed: @87a * // ji ltar med de /

analyzed: 'byung ba gzhan shas che bas 'byung ba gzhan zil gyis non na mi dmigs te /
