translated: If it were well established that they exist, then it would be possible to know them. But they are not well established as existing.

original: thams cad la kha dog la sogs pa'i bye brag thams cad yod par thal bar gyur na mi rung bas so //
analyzed: thams cad la kha dog la sogs pa'i bye brag thams cad yod par thal bar gyur na mi rung bas so //
translated: Because it is not tenable that all the various colors and so on exist in everything.

original: 'od la sogs pa gang la yang sra ba la sogs pa nyid yod par rab tu grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'od la sogs pa gang la yang sra ba la sogs pa nyid yod par rab tu grub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not well established that solidity and so on exist in light and so on.

original: de dag mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i phyir ma yin gyi zil gyis non pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par bya /
analyzed: de dag mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i phyir ma yin gyi zil gyis non pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par bya /
translated: How do you know that the nonapprehension of those is not due to their nonexistence, but due to their being overwhelmed?

original: chu skyur ba btab kyang de'i ro ni dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: chu skyur ba btab kyang de'i ro ni dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: The taste of the sour water is apprehended.

original: 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehenders are different.

original: 'o na ni chu dang rdo ba la sogs pa rnams la yang rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad pas mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid dag dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni chu dang rdo ba la sogs pa rnams la yang rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad pas mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid dag dmigs pa yin te /
translated: But water, stone, etc., also are observed to have solidity, fluidity, and heat, since their characteristics increase when they encounter special conditions,

original: sa'i dri dag bzhin no zhe na /üîΩmtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: sa'i dri dag bzhin no zhe na / mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: just like the smells of earth.üîΩWe reply, their characteristics increase, but they do not arise.

original: skyes pa'i phyir ma yin pa 'di ji ltar shes par bya /üîΩde lta na ni ha cang thal ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i phyir ma yin pa 'di ji ltar shes par bya / de lta na ni ha cang thal ches par 'gyur te /
translated: How do you know that?

original: reg bya gzhan bzhin du gzugs dang dri dang ro gzhan rnams dang / sgra yang rkyen rnyed pas dmigs pa'i snga rol nas yod pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg bya gzhan bzhin du gzugs dang dri dang ro gzhan rnams dang / sgra yang rkyen rnyed pas dmigs pa'i snga rol nas yod pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow, absurdly, that form, smell, and taste, like the other tangible objects, and sound as well, would exist prior to their observation, since they would be found when the conditions are present.üîΩIn another s≈´tra it says,

original: mdo sde gzhan las kyang dge slong bsam gtan byed pa yin zhing rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las kyang dge slong bsam gtan byed pa yin zhing rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, there are those who practice meditation and have achieved the superknowledges.

original: sems la dbang thob pa yin na ni shing gi sdong po 'di la khams gang dang gang du mos pa de yang de bzhin du 'gyur te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems la dbang thob pa yin na ni shing gi sdong po 'di la khams gang dang gang du mos pa de yang de bzhin du 'gyur te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If one has mastery over the mind, then whatever element one wishes to be present in a given part of a tree trunk, that will happen, not otherwise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shing gi sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod pas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shing gi sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod pas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because a tree trunk has various elements.

original: de ltar na rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad na sra ba nyid la sogs pa dag rang rang gi khams las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad na sra ba nyid la sogs pa dag rang rang gi khams las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if it encounters a specific condition, solidity, etc., will arise from its own element.

original: khams dag dum bu dag kyang ma yin te //
analyzed: khams dag dum bu dag kyang ma yin te //
translated: The elements are not parts,

original: cha shas gcig la yang ji ltar mos pa bzhin du yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de la yang du ma bu mtha' yas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas gcig la yang ji ltar mos pa bzhin du yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de la yang du ma bu mtha' yas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, even in a single part, there is a transformation in accordance with the wish, and because an infinite number of parts is not possible.

original: sa'i dri ni snga nas kyang dmigs pa nyid yin na de chus gtor na brtas bar 'gyur bar shes par bya nus so //
analyzed: sa'i dri ni snga nas kyang dmigs pa nyid yin na de chus gtor na brtas bar 'gyur bar shes par bya nus so //
translated: The smell of earth is already perceived, and it is possible to know that it will increase when watered.

original: gang zhig rkyen dang @87b phrad pas brtas par gyur par shes par rung ba sra ba la sogs pa rnams ni rkyen med na chu la sogs pa rnams la de ltar yod par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen dang @87b phrad pas brtas par gyur par shes par rung ba sra ba la sogs pa rnams ni rkyen med na chu la sogs pa rnams la de ltar yod par mi dmigs so //
translated: The hardness, etc., that can be recognized as increased by contact with conditions are not perceived to exist in that way in water, etc., when there are no conditions.

original: de bas na gong bur bshad pa la skyon gyi gnas skabs de nyid yod do //
analyzed: de bas na gong bur bshad pa la skyon gyi gnas skabs de nyid yod do //
translated: Therefore, the error is in the explanation of the aggregate.

original: 'on te rigs las so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rigs las so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is from the type,

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then all derivative form would not be derived from the four great elements,

original: 'dus pa kha cig las 'byung pa chen po kha cig yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa kha cig las 'byung pa chen po kha cig yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you do not accept that some collections of atoms have some great elements and do not have others.

original: de lta na ni mdo sde dang 'gal te skye mched so so ba'i mdo sde las skye mched dgu po rnams ni re re yang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir dang / lag pa rdob pa lta bu las kyang mig gi sha'i gong bu la 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag yod par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni mdo sde dang 'gal te skye mched so so ba'i mdo sde las skye mched dgu po rnams ni re re yang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir dang / lag pa rdob pa lta bu las kyang mig gi sha'i gong bu la 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag yod par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you maintain that, you contradict the sutras, because the sutra on the individual bases explains, ‚ÄúEach of the nine bases is derived from the four great elements,‚Äù and because the sutra on the shaking of the hand explains that the eye is a fleshy globe that is derived from the four great elements.

original: mdor na rigs pa ni 'dir tshad ma rnam pa gsum po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: mdor na rigs pa ni 'dir tshad ma rnam pa gsum po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: In brief, here reasoning is the three types of valid knowledge: direct perception, inference, and authoritative statements.

original: de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig dang 'gal bar brgal ba yang rigs pa dang 'gal par brgal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig dang 'gal bar brgal ba yang rigs pa dang 'gal par brgal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that any argument that contradicts any of these is a contradiction of reasoning.

original: dper na dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa yod do //
analyzed: dper na dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa yod do //
translated: For example, the sutra says, ‚ÄúMonks, the past form that existed

original: gzugs ma 'ongs pa yod do //
analyzed: gzugs ma 'ongs pa yod do //
translated: The future form that will exist

original: 'das pa dang zad pa dang 'gags pa dang bral ba dang yongs su gyur pa gang yin pa de yod do zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang zad pa dang 'gags pa dang bral ba dang yongs su gyur pa gang yin pa de yod do zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: To say that what is past, destroyed, ceased, transformed, is existent is to contradict direct perception.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med pa nyid yin par mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med pa nyid yin par mngon sum yin te /
translated: For the past and the future are non-existent, as is shown by direct perception.

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu bzhin no //
translated: For example, the hair of a tortoise and the beard of a bird.

original: 'das pa'ang yin la yod pa'ang yin zhes bya ba 'di snga phyi 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'ang yin la yod pa'ang yin zhes bya ba 'di snga phyi 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: To say that the past exists and that it does not exist is contradictory, because the past and the future are mutually exclusive.

original: gal te yod na de ji ltar 'das pa yin /
analyzed: gal te yod na de ji ltar 'das pa yin /
translated: If it exists, how can it be past?

original: ma 'ongs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same holds for the future.üîΩIn another Sutra, it is said:

original: mdo sde gzhan las mig skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las mig skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
translated: When the eye arises, it does not come from anywhere;

original: 'gag pa na gang du yang stsogs par mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa na gang du yang stsogs par mi 'gro'o //
translated: when it ceases, it does not go anywhere in a pile.üîΩBhikshus, thus, the eye arises from what has not existed; having arisen, it is destroyed.

original: dge slong dag de ltar na mig ni ma skyes pa las skye zhing skyes nas kyang 'jig go zhes gsungs pas de dang 'dir 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na mig ni ma skyes pa las skye zhing skyes nas kyang 'jig go zhes gsungs pas de dang 'dir 'gal ba yin no //
translated: This is contradictory to the present Sutra.

original: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe escape from form is the formless‚Äù is contradicted by inference.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la rag las te skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du sbyin pa las byung @88a * //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la rag las te skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro // de bzhin du sbyin pa las byung @88a * //
translated: For it is seen that feeling, etc., arise in dependence on form.

original: ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te lan mang du byas na longs spyod chen po nyid 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te lan mang du byas na longs spyod chen po nyid 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, the statement ‚Äúthe basis of meritorious action consisting of giving, when cultivated, developed, and made much of, brings about the attainment of great wealth‚Äù is contradicted by inference.

original: ser sna can la phyug pa dang / gtong ba la dbul po yang snang ste /
analyzed: ser sna can la phyug pa dang / gtong ba la dbul po yang snang ste /
translated: For it is seen that the miser is wealthy and the generous person is poor.

original: ser sna can yang phyug po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / gtong ba yang dbul po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna can yang phyug po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / gtong ba yang dbul po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The miser is wealthy and the generous person is poor because the miser is not generous and the generous person is generous.

original: sbyin pa la goms na yang ser sna can du 'gyur bar mi 'os la sbyin pa la goms na yang gtong ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la goms na yang ser sna can du 'gyur bar mi 'os la sbyin pa la goms na yang gtong ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not proper that one who is habituated to giving becomes a miser, and one who is habituated to giving does not become generous.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni spangs la mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni ma spangs pa'i gang zag yod do zhes bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni spangs la mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni ma spangs pa'i gang zag yod do zhes bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: So too, it would follow that there are persons who have abandoned the fetter of birth but not abandoned the fetter of actualized states, but this contradicts the following inference.

original: gang zhigs gang du skye ba'i srid pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni srid pa bar ma do las kyang gdon mi za bar 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhigs gang du skye ba'i srid pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni srid pa bar ma do las kyang gdon mi za bar 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: One who is free from attachment to the existence that is birth in a certain realm is also definitely free from attachment to the intermediate existence that is the state of an intermediate being.

original: dge bsnyen gyi bslab pa'i gzhi lnga zhes bya ba so so'i tshig gi don rab tu dbye ba bshad pa de las chang 'thung ba bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi bslab pa'i gzhi lnga zhes bya ba so so'i tshig gi don rab tu dbye ba bshad pa de las chang 'thung ba bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The statement the five precepts of a layperson are precepts that possess a proscribed offense that is a drinking alcohol is a contradiction of scripture because it is said:

original: lus kyi nyes par spyad pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: lus kyi nyes par spyad pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of physical negative action.

original: srog gcod pa nas myos par 'gyur ba'i khu ba chang 'thung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung bas bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la ni nyes par spyod pa yin no zhes mi brjod do //
analyzed: srog gcod pa nas myos par 'gyur ba'i khu ba chang 'thung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung bas bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la ni nyes par spyod pa yin no zhes mi brjod do //
translated: Thus, the ten unwholesome actions are not called ‚Äúmisconduct‚Äù in the case of the unwholesome actions that are natural offenses.

original: de bzhin du shin tu rgyas pa'i sde ni theg pa chen po yin no zhes gang bshad pa yang lung dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu rgyas pa'i sde ni theg pa chen po yin no zhes gang bshad pa yang lung dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, the explanation that the vaipulya is the Great Vehicle contradicts the scriptures.

original: kha cig na re mdo sde'i le'u grangs rgyas pa rnams ni shin tu rgyas pa'i sde yin gyi theg pa chen po ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo sde'i le'u grangs rgyas pa rnams ni shin tu rgyas pa'i sde yin gyi theg pa chen po ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: The vaipulya is the extensive chapters of the sutra collection, but it is not the Great Vehicle.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not the speech of the Buddha.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not the speech of the Buddha?

original: 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it contradicts the scriptures.

original: de ni sde pa thams cad la grags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni sde pa thams cad la grags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It contradicts the scriptures of all schools.üîΩThus it says in the sutra:

original: 'di ltar de las ni chos thams cad ni rang bzhin med pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar de las ni chos thams cad ni rang bzhin med pa /
translated: All phenomena are essenceless,

original: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa /
translated: Unarisen and unceasing,

original: chos thams cad ni gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: all phenomena are primordially peace,üîΩand naturally in a state of nirvana.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rab 'byor gzugs ni @88b dngos po med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rab 'byor gzugs ni @88b dngos po med do //
translated: And similarly, Subhuti, form is not a thing.

original: rab 'byor byang chub kyi bar du yang dngos po med do zhes 'byung la /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub kyi bar du yang dngos po med do zhes 'byung la /
translated: Subhuti, up to enlightenment is not a thing.

original: sde pa thams cad la grags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sde pa thams cad la grags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: In the Buddha's teachings renowned to all schools, the Lord said, What is ignorance?

original: gang de dang sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: gang de dang sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
translated: It is not knowing the past, and so on, up toüîΩold age and death.

original: rga shi'i bar du chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yang bstan /
analyzed: rga shi'i bar du chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yang bstan /
translated: He taught the nature of phenomena up to old age and death.

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: Because this exists, that arises.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye /
translated: Because this is produced, that is produced.

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye /
translated: Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: 'du byed 'di dag thams cad ni 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed 'di dag thams cad ni 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: All these compounded phenomena are past, exhausted, ceased, separated, and transformed.

original: kye me 'du byed rnams mi rtag / skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
analyzed: kye me 'du byed rnams mi rtag / skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
translated: they have the nature of arising and destruction.

original: skyes nas 'jig par 'gyur bas na //
analyzed: skyes nas 'jig par 'gyur bas na //
translated: Having arisen, they cease.

original: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
analyzed: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
translated: Their pacification is bliss.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Monks, it is like this:

original: 'du byed rnams ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Conditioned things are suffering.üîΩNirvana is peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba dang / rgyu kun 'byung ba las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba dang / rgyu kun 'byung ba las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba yin la /
translated: From the arising of the cause, suffering arises.

original: rgyu 'gags pa las sdug bsngal 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'gags pa las sdug bsngal 'gog pa yin no //
translated: From the cessation of the cause, suffering ceases.

original: rgyu dang bcas pas bde 'gror 'gro //üîΩrgyur bcas nyid kyis ngan 'gror te //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pas bde 'gror 'gro // rgyur bcas nyid kyis ngan 'gror te //
translated: With cause, one goes to good rebirths.üîΩWith cause, one goes to bad rebirths.

original: rgyu dang bcas pas mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pas mya ngan 'da' //
translated: With cause, one attains nirvana.

original: 'di kun rgyu dang bcas las byung //
analyzed: 'di kun rgyu dang bcas las byung //
translated: All this arises from action with cause.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs ni mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba 'gyur ba'i chos can no zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten na mkhas pa rnams kyis yod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni nga yang yod par smra'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung bas skye ba la sogs pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs ni mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba 'gyur ba'i chos can no zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten na mkhas pa rnams kyis yod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni nga yang yod par smra'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung bas skye ba la sogs pa yang bstan to //
translated: and similarly, ‚ÄúForm is impermanent, painful, and subject to change,‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhatever exists in the world, and is accepted by the wise, I also say exists.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rab tu grags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang 'gal bas theg pa chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu grags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang 'gal bas theg pa chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it contradicts the well-known teachings of the Buddha, the MahƒÅyƒÅna is not the word of the Buddha.

original: de bas na shin tu rgyas pa'i sde ni theg pa chen po yin no zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na shin tu rgyas pa'i sde ni theg pa chen po yin no zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the extensive scriptures are the MahƒÅyƒÅna, and this contradicts the scriptures.

analyzed: /'di ltar 'phul bar byed pa la ma ltos par ni gru 'gro ba yang med la ljon shing 'gul ba yang med do //

original: skye ba'i rgyu la ma ltos par me 'byung ba yang med la /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu la ma ltos par me 'byung ba yang med la /
translated: Without depending on the cause of arising, fire does not arise.

original: gzhi la mi ltos par chu gnas pa yang med do //
analyzed: gzhi la mi ltos par chu gnas pa yang med do //
translated: And water does not remain without depending on a receptacle.

original: gal te de lta yin du zin kyang gru ni rten du gyur pa nyid kyis rang gi bya ba dag la ltos pa med par 'jug go //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin du zin kyang gru ni rten du gyur pa nyid kyis rang gi bya ba dag la ltos pa med par 'jug go //
translated: Even if that is so, a boat is a support because it is independent with regard to its own function.

original: de lta bas na de ni de la rang dbang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni de la rang dbang yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it has independence with regard to that.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro zhe na /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro zhe na /
translated: The same should be applied to the rest.

original: de la byung ba'i phyir na rten gyur pa'i //
analyzed: de la byung ba'i phyir na rten gyur pa'i //
translated: Because it arises, it is a support.

original: de yang de dang gzhan du 'brel phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de dang gzhan du 'brel phyir ro //
translated: And because it is related to that and to something else.

original: 'di ltar de la 'byung ba gang yin pa'i gru de bya ba dag la rten du gyur par brtags grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la 'byung ba gang yin pa'i gru de bya ba dag la rten du gyur par brtags grang na /
translated: In this way, if a boat, which is an arising, is considered to be a support with regard to functions,

original: de yang de dang rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ji ltar de la rang dbang yod pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang de dang rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ji ltar de la rang dbang yod pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: how can it have independence, since it arises from being related to that and to other causes?

original: bya ba gang byung ba ni de la gnas pa'i phyir de la gnas pa na gru dang rang dbang yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba gang byung ba ni de la gnas pa'i phyir de la gnas pa na gru dang rang dbang yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that a function is a support because it arises and remains there, and when it remains there, the boat has independence,

original: gang la de rang dbang yod pas de'i tshe de la ci zhig byar yod /
analyzed: gang la de rang dbang yod pas de'i tshe de la ci zhig byar yod /
translated: Since it is independent of that, what can it do at that time?

original: skye ba yang skye ba po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin na de de'i rten du ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: skye ba yang skye ba po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin na de de'i rten du ji ltar rigs /
translated: If arising were to exist in the nature of the one who arises, how could it be the basis of that?

original: bdag nyid du ma gyur ba yang de la 'byung re skan /
analyzed: bdag nyid du ma gyur ba yang de la 'byung re skan /
translated: If it does not exist in the nature of that, how could it arise from that?

original: skye ba la yang skye ba thug pa med par gyur pas ha cang thal ches par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba la yang skye ba thug pa med par gyur pas ha cang thal ches par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If arising were to exist in the nature of the one who arises, since arising would be without end, this would be utterly untenable.

original: 'o na brjod par 'dod pa las byed pa po rnams kyi sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na brjod par 'dod pa las byed pa po rnams kyi sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if you think that the expression ‚Äúthe one who arises‚Äù is used in the sense of the one who is engaged in activity,

original: gang gi tshe gru 'gro ba la rang dbang yod pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe gru 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gru 'gro ba la rang dbang yod pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe gru 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then when you assert that the boat has the power to go, the expression ‚Äúthe boat goes‚Äù is used.

original: gang gi tshe bdag nyid thob pa la rang dbang yod pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag nyid thob pa la rang dbang yod pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: When you assert that the self has the power to obtain itself, the expression ‚Äúthe self arises‚Äù is used.

original: gal te brjod par 'dod pa las yin na gru 'dren pa na 'gro'o zhes zer ba ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid dam /
analyzed: gal te brjod par 'dod pa las yin na gru 'dren pa na 'gro'o zhes zer ba ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid dam /
translated: If it is from what is desired to be expressed, then when sailing a boat, one says ‚Äúgo‚Äù to the boatman.üîΩ

original: rang dbang yod pa nyid dam /
analyzed: rang dbang yod pa nyid dam /
translated: If it is from what is desired to be expressed, then when a boat is being pulled, if one says ‚Äúit goes,‚Äù is it the other-powered nature or the nature of self-power that is expressed?

original: ci zhig tu brjod par 'dod /
analyzed: ci zhig tu brjod par 'dod /
translated: Or what is it that is expressed?

original: de bzhin du 'byin par byed pa na me 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yang ci zhig brjod par 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byin par byed pa na me 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yang ci zhig brjod par 'dod pa yin /
translated: Similarly, when fire is being produced, what is it that is expressed when one says ‚Äúfire arises‚Äù?

original: smras pa / gnyi ga yin no zhe na /üîΩmtshan nyid @91a * //
analyzed: smras pa / gnyi ga yin no zhe na / mtshan nyid @91a * //
translated: If you say both,

original: med bzhin du yang mkhas pas ci dgar byed pa po rnams sbyar bar rung ngam /
analyzed: med bzhin du yang mkhas pas ci dgar byed pa po rnams sbyar bar rung ngam /
translated: then is it suitable for the wise to apply the agent to that which is without a defining characteristic as they wish?

original: smras pa rung ste /
analyzed: smras pa rung ste /
translated: It is suitable,üîΩbecause in this way, since it holds its own defining characteristic, it is called a phenomenon.

original: 'di ltar nges pa'i tshig gi chos nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na chos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba de la byed pa po dang las dang bya ba'i dbye ba yang med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges pa'i tshig gi chos nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na chos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba de la byed pa po dang las dang bya ba'i dbye ba yang med la /
translated: In that, there is no division of agent, action, and object,

original: brjod par 'dod pa las ni de'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa las ni de'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: but it is from what is desired to be expressed that its application occurs.

original: gal te rung na byed pa po dang bya ba'i dbye ba med kyang rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yang ci'i phyir mi rung /
analyzed: gal te rung na byed pa po dang bya ba'i dbye ba med kyang rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yang ci'i phyir mi rung /
translated: If that is acceptable, then why is this unacceptable: ‚Äúconsciousness is so called because it is that which is conscious‚Äù?

original: ci'i phyir na 'di la byed pa po med bzhin du brjod par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na 'di la byed pa po med bzhin du brjod par 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it said that there is no agent in this case?

original: rnam par shes pa tsam la byed pa po nyid du tha snyad 'dogs kyi bdag tu lta bas kun tu brtags pa'i byed pa po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam la byed pa po nyid du tha snyad 'dogs kyi bdag tu lta bas kun tu brtags pa'i byed pa po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that the mere consciousness is designated as the agent, but the agent imagined by the view of self does not exist at all.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du rab tu shes par byed pas na shes rab po zhes bya ba yang rigs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du rab tu shes par byed pas na shes rab po zhes bya ba yang rigs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Just as it is said that consciousness is so called because it is that which is conscious, it is also reasonable to say that wisdom is so called because it is that which knows.

original: 'jig rten na khyim gyi grva zhum mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na khyim gyi grva zhum mo //
translated: In the world, a corner of a house is called ‚Äúsagging,‚Äù

original: grva rlos so //
analyzed: grva rlos so //
translated: a corner is called ‚Äúflopping,‚Äù

original: sgo 'di yul bcom brlag tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgo 'di yul bcom brlag tu 'byung ngo //
translated: and a door is called ‚Äúcoming from the land of MathurƒÅ.‚Äù

original: lam 'di yul bcom brlag tu 'gro'o zhes gang ji skad du zer ba yang de dag la brjod par 'dod pa byed pa po 'ga' yang ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: lam 'di yul bcom brlag tu 'gro'o zhes gang ji skad du zer ba yang de dag la brjod par 'dod pa byed pa po 'ga' yang ci zhig yod de /
translated: What is the point of saying that this path goes to MathurƒÅ?

original: de lta bas na brjod par 'dod pa byed pa po med par yang byed pa po nyid du bshad pa ni legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na brjod par 'dod pa byed pa po med par yang byed pa po nyid du bshad pa ni legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is better to explain that the agent exists without the existence of the one who desires to express.

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sbyor ba ni byed pa po gcig la bya ba gnyis yod pa'i dus snga ma shos kyi bya ba la 'byung ba yin no zhes gang smras pa de ci khyod
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sbyor ba ni byed pa po gcig la bya ba gnyis yod pa'i dus snga ma shos kyi bya ba la 'byung ba yin no zhes gang smras pa de ci khyod
translated: You say that the statement ‚ÄúEye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms‚Äù is an example of the same person performing two actions, where the first action is the arising of the eye consciousness.

original: 'dod pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod pa yin nam /
translated: Do you accept this?

original: 'on te 'jig rten na de ltar mthong ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten na de ltar mthong ba yin /
translated: Or is it that this is seen in the world?

original: smras pa / 'jig rten na de ltar mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten na de ltar mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is seen in the world,

original: 'jig rten na ni gzhan du yang mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni gzhan du yang mthong ste /

original: 'di ltar de lta bu'i sbyor ba ni byed pa po tha dad pa la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de lta bu'i sbyor ba ni byed pa po tha dad pa la yang mthong ste /
translated: For example, this type of statement is seen in the case of different agents.

original: dper na mar 'thungs nas stobs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na mar 'thungs nas stobs 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, one says: ‚ÄúI have strength because I have drunk oil.‚Äù

original: seng ge mthong nas 'jigs pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //üîΩde bzhin du skar rgyal skyes sam /
analyzed: seng ge mthong nas 'jigs pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba lta bu yin no // de bzhin du skar rgyal skyes sam /
translated: And one says: ‚ÄúI am afraid because I have seen a lion.‚ÄùüîΩIn the same way, one would say: ‚ÄúThe visual consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and on visible form.‚Äù

original: rgyal la skyes gang yin pa de'i mig de la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //üîΩdus snga ma shos ma yin pa la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyal la skyes gang yin pa de'i mig de la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro // dus snga ma shos ma yin pa la yang mthong ste /
translated: But this is not the case, for the eye is not the prior condition of the visual consciousness.

original: dper na kha gdangs nas nyal @91b zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dper na kha gdangs nas nyal @91b zhes bya ba'am /
translated: For example, one says: ‚ÄúHe sleeps with his mouth open.‚Äù

original: mig btsums nas nyal zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩci kha gdangs nas sam /
analyzed: mig btsums nas nyal zhes bya ba lta bu'o // ci kha gdangs nas sam /
translated: Or one says: ‚ÄúHe sleeps with his eyes closed.‚Äù

original: mig btsums nas dus phyi ma la nyal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mig btsums nas dus phyi ma la nyal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that he opens his mouth or closes his eyes at the very moment when he goes to sleep?

original: mi rung ste /üîΩji ltar sngar khrus byas nas phyis za ba lta bur sngar kha gdangs pa'am /üîΩmig 'dzums par byed la /
analyzed: mi rung ste / ji ltar sngar khrus byas nas phyis za ba lta bur sngar kha gdangs pa'am / mig 'dzums par byed la /
translated: No, that is not the case.

original: phyis nyal ba'i don 'dir ni khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis nyal ba'i don 'dir ni khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For one does not understand the meaning of the expression ‚Äúto sleep with one‚Äôs mouth open‚Äù or ‚Äúto sleep with one‚Äôs eyes closed‚Äù in the sense that one opens one‚Äôs mouth or closes one‚Äôs eyes prior to sleeping,

original: 'on kyang kha gdangs pa'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang kha gdangs pa'am /
translated: as one washes one‚Äôs hands or eats.üîΩBut rather, one understands it in the sense that one sleeps with one‚Äôs mouth open or with one‚Äôs eyes closed.

original: mig btsums pa ni nyal ba dang dus mnyam du 'byung ba yin par mngon te /
analyzed: mig btsums pa ni nyal ba dang dus mnyam du 'byung ba yin par mngon te /
translated: It is evident that closing the eyes occurs simultaneously with lying down,

original: 'di ltar kha gdangs nas phyis nyal bar byed pa gal te kha ma gdangs na kha gdangs nas nyal bar byed ces bya bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'di ltar kha gdangs nas phyis nyal bar byed pa gal te kha ma gdangs na kha gdangs nas nyal bar byed ces bya bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because if one opens one‚Äôs mouth and then lies down, one would not say, ‚ÄúI open my mouth and then lie down,‚Äù but rather, ‚ÄúI open my mouth and lie down.‚Äù

original: / de bzhin du /üîΩ'od ldan rnams ni 'od dag gis //
analyzed: / de bzhin du / 'od ldan rnams ni 'od dag gis //
translated: Similarly,üîΩthe luminous ones,üîΩhaving filled the world with light,

original: 'jig rten bkang nas der shar to //
analyzed: 'jig rten bkang nas der shar to //
translated: arose there.

original: gang gis cha shas zhugs nas kyang //
analyzed: gang gis cha shas zhugs nas kyang //
translated: Having entered a part,

original: nang na yod pa'i mun pa bsal //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu ste /üîΩde ni sngar 'gengs ba'am 'jug par byed la phyis 'char ba'am /
analyzed: nang na yod pa'i mun pa bsal // zhes bya ba lta bu ste / de ni sngar 'gengs ba'am 'jug par byed la phyis 'char ba'am /

original: sel ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sel ba yang ma yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du khar ba khral zhes zer nas lhung zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: Similarly, when one says, ‚ÄúThe stick fell with a snap,‚Äù

analyzed: de yang sngar khrol zhes zer la phyis lhung ba yang ma yin te / khar ba lhung ba na sgra khral zhes zer te /

analyzed: brgyab pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyor ba ni rgyu'i don la yang mthong ste /
translated: Such a process is also seen in the sense of cause.

original: dper na bud shing la brten nas me 'byung /
analyzed: dper na bud shing la brten nas me 'byung /
translated: For example, fire arises in dependence on fuel,

original: til la brten nas til mar 'byung /
analyzed: til la brten nas til mar 'byung /

translated: However, it is evident that rain falls in dependence on clouds, just as stated.

analyzed: gzhan yang gang la snga phyi bya ba dag dmigs pa de kha cig la de lta bu'i sbyor ba'i rgyu'i don nyid du mthong ste /

original: dper na mar 'thungs nas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na mar 'thungs nas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is said, ‚ÄúDrink oil and you will become strong.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar mar 'thungs pa dang stobs dang ldan pa dag ni ji ltar khrus bya ba dang / zas za ba dag ltar snga phyi tsam du rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi /

original: mar 'thungs pa'i rgyu las stobs dang ldan pa nyid 'byung bar shes par bya'o //üîΩde bzhin du mig dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba na mig dang gzugs la brten @92a * //
analyzed: mar 'thungs pa'i rgyu las stobs dang ldan pa nyid 'byung bar shes par bya'o // de bzhin du mig dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba na mig dang gzugs la brten @92a * //
translated: One should understand that strength comes from the cause of drinking milk.

original: nas skye'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nas skye'o zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, when visual consciousness arises with form as its object condition, it is said to arise in dependence on the eye and form.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid gsal bar mdzad ba ni 'di skad ces bka' stsal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid gsal bar mdzad ba ni 'di skad ces bka' stsal te /

analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: Because this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ste /
translated: from the arising of this, that arises.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:üîΩWith ignorance as condition, there are volitions.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said that and so on.

original: sbyor ba 'di ci nas kyang rgyu'i don kho na yin par shes par bya'i /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di ci nas kyang rgyu'i don kho na yin par shes par bya'i /
translated: This is the only way to understand the meaning of the expression ‚Äúat the time when it arises.‚Äù

original: dus snga ma shos kyi bya ba'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus snga ma shos kyi bya ba'i don du ni ma yin no //
translated: This expression does not mean ‚Äúat the time when it is in the process of arising.‚Äù

original: re zhig 'di yang dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'di yang dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Let us examine this point.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i tshe ci rnam par shes pa yod dam 'on te med /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i tshe ci rnam par shes pa yod dam 'on te med /
translated: When consciousness arises, is it existent or nonexistent?

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: gal te yod na de'i tshe de skyes pa nyid yin pas yang ji ltar skye /

original: byung ba ni skyes pa yin gyis yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byung ba ni skyes pa yin gyis yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that what has arisen is not existent,

analyzed: gang gi tshe de zhig pa'i tshe skyes pa yin par 'gyur ro //
