original: nges pa'i tshig las kyang yod pa zhes bya ba ni sems can skyes pa nges par gzung ba la bya'o zhes bshad pas de yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig las kyang yod pa zhes bya ba ni sems can skyes pa nges par gzung ba la bya'o zhes bshad pas de yang 'gal lo //
translated: The etymological explanation of the word ‚Äúexistent‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which is ascertained to have arisen.‚Äù

original: gal te yang yod pa ma skyes pa zhig yin na skye ba'i snga rol na yod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang yod pa ma skyes pa zhig yin na skye ba'i snga rol na yod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that what is existent is not arisen, then it will be existent before it arises.

original: de'i phyir brten nas zhes bya ba yang grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir brten nas zhes bya ba yang grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is also established that it is dependent.

original: yang skye ba'i tshe yang ma skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: yang skye ba'i tshe yang ma skyes pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, when it arises, it is not arisen.

original: skye ba'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa skyes pa yin no //
translated: After it arises, consciousness arises.

original: de'i tshe yang de zhig pa kho na yin pas gang gi tshe zhig pa de'i tshe skyes pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang de zhig pa kho na yin pas gang gi tshe zhig pa de'i tshe skyes pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, it is just destroyed, so when it is destroyed, it would be arisen.üîΩBut if it is nonexistent, how could it arise? In the same way, why not accept that it is dependent even though it does not exist prior to arising?

original: 'on te med pa zhig yin na ji ltar de med kyang skye ba de bzhin du skye ba'i snga rol nas med kyang brten nas zhes bya bar 'gyur bar yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod na yang yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba thal ches pa'i tshig mangüîΩpo bor te /
analyzed: 'on te med pa zhig yin na ji ltar de med kyang skye ba de bzhin du skye ba'i snga rol nas med kyang brten nas zhes bya bar 'gyur bar yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod na yang yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba thal ches pa'i tshig mang po bor te /
translated: But the expression ‚Äúit exists or it does not exist‚Äù is a redundant statement.

original: ci de'i tshe rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis bdag tu bcas pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci de'i tshe rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis bdag tu bcas pa yin nam /
translated: At that time, is consciousness established as having the nature of consciousness?

original: bdag min pa yin zhes dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag min pa yin zhes dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Or is it not established as having the nature of consciousness?

original: gal te bdag tu bcas pa yin na de'i tshe de skyes pa nyid yin pas yang skye bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu bcas pa yin na de'i tshe de skyes pa nyid yin pas yang skye bas ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is established as having the nature of consciousness, then it is already arisen, so what use is there for it to arise again?

original: 'on te bdag med pa yin na ji ltar de bdag med bar skye bdag la byed pa po yin pa de bzhin du brten nas zhes bya ba yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te bdag med pa yin na ji ltar de bdag med bar skye bdag la byed pa po yin pa de bzhin du brten nas zhes bya ba yang grub pa yin no //
translated: Just as it is an agent, so too it is a dependent origination.

original: re zhig skye zhes bya ba'i don 'di ci yin /
analyzed: re zhig skye zhes bya ba'i don 'di ci yin /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúarises‚Äù?

original: 'byung bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe na /
translated: It means ‚Äúcomes into existence.‚Äù

original: 'byung bar byed ces bya ba gang yin @92b pa des ci zhig byed na 'di ltar byed pa por brjod /
analyzed: 'byung bar byed ces bya ba gang yin @92b pa des ci zhig byed na 'di ltar byed pa por brjod /
translated: What does it do when it comes into existence that it is called an agent?

original: skye bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: skye bar byed do zhe na /
translated: It causes arising.

original: gal te skye ba bskyed par bya ba'i bdag tu gyur pa yin na ji ltar rang la byed /
analyzed: gal te skye ba bskyed par bya ba'i bdag tu gyur pa yin na ji ltar rang la byed /
translated: If arising causes the generation of that which is a self, how could it be generated from itself?

original: 'on te bdag tu gyur pa ma yin na ni de de las logs shig na mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'on te bdag tu gyur pa ma yin na ni de de las logs shig na mi dmigs so //
translated: But if it is not a self, it is not observed to be separate from that.

original: yang na don gang gis na de byed ces bya /
analyzed: yang na don gang gis na de byed ces bya /
translated: Or else, by what meaning of ‚Äúit‚Äù is it said that ‚Äúit causes that‚Äù?

original: byed pa la rang gi don ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: byed pa la rang gi don ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no meaning of ‚Äúit‚Äù in the action.

original: 'di ltar bde ba byed ces bya ba ni skyed ces bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba byed ces bya ba ni skyed ces bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúit causes pleasure‚Äù is understood as ‚Äúit generates pleasure.‚Äù

original: kha spu byed ces bya ba ni 'dreg par byed ces bya bar rtogs so //üîΩrkyal pa la byed ces bya ba nyed par byed ces bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: kha spu byed ces bya ba ni 'dreg par byed ces bya bar rtogs so // rkyal pa la byed ces bya ba nyed par byed ces bya bar rtogs so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúto shave‚Äù means ‚Äúto cut.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression ‚Äúto swim‚Äù means ‚Äúto cross.‚Äù

original: gla byed ces bya ba ni gla byin nas 'chol bar byed ces bya bar rtogs so //üîΩsbyang du 'bras byed ces bya ba ni 'jog par byed ces bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: gla byed ces bya ba ni gla byin nas 'chol bar byed ces bya bar rtogs so // sbyang du 'bras byed ces bya ba ni 'jog par byed ces bya bar rtogs so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúto hire‚Äù means ‚Äúto employ after having given wages.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression ‚Äúto thresh rice‚Äù means ‚Äúto place the rice in a winnowing basket.‚Äù

original: pha'i tshig bzhin byed ces bya ba ni des smras pa bzhin du sgrub par byed ces bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: pha'i tshig bzhin byed ces bya ba ni des smras pa bzhin du sgrub par byed ces bya bar rtogs so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúto do as one‚Äôs father says‚Äù means ‚Äúto do what he tells one to do.‚Äù

original: skabs byed ces bya ba ni sgrib pa sel bar byed ces bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: skabs byed ces bya ba ni sgrib pa sel bar byed ces bya bar rtogs so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúto make an opportunity‚Äù means ‚Äúto remove the obstacle.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na skye ba'i byed pa po'i byed ces bya ba'i don brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba'i byed pa po'i byed ces bya ba'i don brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the expression ‚Äúto produce‚Äù must be explained.

original: gal te skyed par byed pa'i don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyed par byed pa'i don yin no zhe na /
translated: If it means ‚Äúto generate,‚Äù

original: skye ba yang skye bar 'gyur pas de la yang skye ba gzhan yod de /
analyzed: skye ba yang skye bar 'gyur pas de la yang skye ba gzhan yod de /
translated: then arising would be generated, and so there would have to be another arising for that arising.

original: thug pa med pas ha cang thal ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pas ha cang thal ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: This would lead to an infinite regress.

original: yang na de la skye ba'i rag lus pa ci zhig yod na gang gi phyir skye bar byed ces bya /
analyzed: yang na de la skye ba'i rag lus pa ci zhig yod na gang gi phyir skye bar byed ces bya /
translated: Or else, if it is dependent on that, what is it that causes it to arise?

original: de lta bas na bya ba med par yang bdag nyid thob pa tsam la byed pa po bzhin du rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba rkyen rnyed pa tsam la brten nas zhes bya ba bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bya ba med par yang bdag nyid thob pa tsam la byed pa po bzhin du rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba rkyen rnyed pa tsam la brten nas zhes bya ba bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, even without activity, consciousness arises merely through the attainment of its own being, just as an agent does. This is explained in the statement, ‚ÄúIt arises in dependence on the mere acquisition of conditions.‚Äù

original: 'di la bya ba 'ga' yang med la byed pa po yang med na /
analyzed: 'di la bya ba 'ga' yang med la byed pa po yang med na /
translated: Since there is no activity at all here, and no agent,

original: byed pa po gcig po nyid ltag la yod de /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig po nyid ltag la yod de /
translated: the very existence of an agent is refuted.

original: de lta bas na brten nas skye zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di ni rigs pa kho na yin no //üîΩmtshan nyid 'dra ba la dgos pa med par bye brag tu bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni dgos pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na brten nas skye zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di ni rigs pa kho na yin no // mtshan nyid 'dra ba la dgos pa med par bye brag tu bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni dgos pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this application of the term ‚Äúarising‚Äù is entirely reasonable.üîΩAs for the explanation of the term ‚Äúform‚Äù as having no purpose other than to indicate something that has the characteristic of form, that is not without purpose.

original: 'di ltar gzugs de la gang ci yang rung ba zhes bshad pa ni gzugs kyi don du mar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs de la gang ci yang rung ba zhes bshad pa ni gzugs kyi don du mar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúWhatever it may be‚Äù is made in order to indicate the meaning of form in a general way.

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi don ni rnam pa gsum ste yul brtag tu rung ba'i don dang / lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis 'gyur ba skyed par gzugs su rung ba'i don dang / gzugs kyi de gdags pa gzugs su rung ba'i don yin te /üîΩ'di ltar bstan @93a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi don ni rnam pa gsum ste yul brtag tu rung ba'i don dang / lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis 'gyur ba skyed par gzugs su rung ba'i don dang / gzugs kyi de gdags pa gzugs su rung ba'i don yin te / 'di ltar bstan @93a * //
translated: Form has three meanings: the meaning of form as a basis for investigation of an object, the meaning of form as that which is suitable to be form since it generates change through contact such as the hand, and the meaning of form as that which is suitable to be the designation of form.üîΩThus, form is form because it is the form that is suitable to be investigated as an object, since it is said, ‚ÄúThis form is here, that form is there.‚Äù

original: du yod pa'i gzugs 'di na'o pha bi na'o zhes yul brtag tu rung ba'i phyir gzugs yin pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis 'gyur ba bskyed pa gzugs su rung ba'i phyir gzugs yin pa dang /
analyzed: du yod pa'i gzugs 'di na'o pha bi na'o zhes yul brtag tu rung ba'i phyir gzugs yin pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis 'gyur ba bskyed pa gzugs su rung ba'i phyir gzugs yin pa dang /
translated: Form is form because it is suitable to be form since it generates change through contact such as the hand, since it is form that possesses obstruction.

original: bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'i gzugs lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba gzugs kyi de gdags pa gzugs su rung ba'i phyir gzugs yin no //
analyzed: bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'i gzugs lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba gzugs kyi de gdags pa gzugs su rung ba'i phyir gzugs yin no //
translated: Form is form because it is suitable to be the designation of form, since it is said, ‚ÄúForm that is not demonstrable and is without obstruction is called nonindicative form of the body and speech.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar de ni lus dang ngag gnyis med na gdags su med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni lus dang ngag gnyis med na gdags su med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, if the body and speech do not exist, it cannot be designated.

original: gzugs med pa na de gdags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na de gdags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not designated in the formless realm.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pa nyid du ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pa nyid du ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How do you know that nonindicative form exists?

original: gang gi phyir skye mched so so ba'i mdo las chos kyi skye mched bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa zhes ni gsungs kyi gzugs can ma yin pa zhes ni ma gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye mched so so ba'i mdo las chos kyi skye mched bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa zhes ni gsungs kyi gzugs can ma yin pa zhes ni ma gsungs pa yin la /
translated: In the sutra that explains the individual bases, the phenomena base is said to be imperceptible and unimpeded, but it is not said to be nonphysical.

original: yang 'di ltar glang po che'i lta bas lta bu las chos kyi skye mched bstan nas /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar glang po che'i lta bas lta bu las chos kyi skye mched bstan nas /
translated: Again, the sutra on the elephant's trance explains the phenomena base and then states:

original: de la chos gzugs can gang dag yin pa 'di ni gzugs kyi phung po yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la chos gzugs can gang dag yin pa 'di ni gzugs kyi phung po yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The physical phenomena included in the phenomena base are the form aggregate.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bor na chos kyi skye mched du gyur pa chos gzugs can gzhan gang dag yod /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bor na chos kyi skye mched du gyur pa chos gzugs can gzhan gang dag yod /
translated: What other physical phenomena are there in the phenomena base apart from nonindicative form?

original: gzugs can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa dag chos yin pa de ltar ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gzugs can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa dag chos yin pa de ltar ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why not assert that past and future physical phenomena are the phenomena base?

original: skye mched so so ba'i mdo dang 'gal te /
analyzed: skye mched so so ba'i mdo dang 'gal te /
translated: This contradicts the sutra that explains the individual sense bases,

original: chos kyi skye mched ni skye mched bcu gcig gis ma bsdus pa bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o zhes 'byung la /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched ni skye mched bcu gcig gis ma bsdus pa bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o zhes 'byung la /
translated: which states: The sense base of mental objects is not included in the eleven sense bases. It is not visible and is not impeded.

original: mig la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni ji ltar rigs par bstan du yod cing thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni ji ltar rigs par bstan du yod cing thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Past and future eyes, etc., are visible and impeded, as is appropriate.

original: yang na gzugs nyid du yang 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: yang na gzugs nyid du yang 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: Or else, you should not assert that they are form,

original: 'di ltar de dag ni de'i tshe gzugs su med pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni de'i tshe gzugs su med pas so //
translated: because at that time they do not exist as form.

original: skye mched bcu po dag kyang dus gsum po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye mched bcu po dag kyang dus gsum po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The ten sense bases would not be in the three times,

original: mig la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni chos kyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni chos kyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because past and future eyes, etc., are the sense base of mental objects.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye mched mang po dag las gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du gsungs pa yang skye mched rnams bcu gnyis kho nar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye mched mang po dag las gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du gsungs pa yang skye mched rnams bcu gnyis kho nar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, one of the many sense bases of form is called the sense base of form in order to establish that the sense bases are only twelve in number.

original: de rnam par gzhag pa yang yul can dang yul nyid du @93b gnyis gnyis 'brel bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag pa yang yul can dang yul nyid du @93b gnyis gnyis 'brel bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and they are presented in this way in order to demonstrate that the object and subject are related as a pair.

original: yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gi yul ni thams cad yin pas gnyis su med pa nyams pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gi yul ni thams cad yin pas gnyis su med pa nyams pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since the object of the mental faculty and the object of one part of the phenomena base are all phenomena, is the presentation of two objects not undermined?

original: 'o na de lta na ni dbang po drug gi dbang du mdzad nas 'brel bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na ni dbang po drug gi dbang du mdzad nas 'brel bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: If that is so, then the presentation of two objects is not undermined because it is stated from the perspective of the six sense faculties.

original: dbang po 'di'i yul ni 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gnyis tshan lnga dag dang / dbang po 'di kho na'i yul ni 'di yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gnyis tshan drug pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po 'di'i yul ni 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gnyis tshan lnga dag dang / dbang po 'di kho na'i yul ni 'di yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gnyis tshan drug pa yin no //
translated: The presentation of two objects is not undermined because the five pairs are stated from the perspective of the six sense faculties, since the object of this sense faculty is only this and not another and the sixth pair is stated from the perspective of the object of the sense faculty, since this is only the object of this sense faculty and not another.

original: dbang po lnga bo dag kyang dbang po drug po kho na'i yul yin pas gnyis tshan drug par nges pa yang nyams pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po lnga bo dag kyang dbang po drug po kho na'i yul yin pas gnyis tshan drug par nges pa yang nyams pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since the five sense faculties are also the object of the six sense faculties, is the presentation of two objects not undermined because it is definite that there are six pairs?

original: 'o na ni dbang po gang kho na'i yul kho na gang yin ba'o zhes gnyis tshan drug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni dbang po gang kho na'i yul kho na gang yin ba'o zhes gnyis tshan drug pa yin no //
translated: The six pairs are the six sense faculties and their six objects.

original: de ltar na dbang po lnga po dag ni chos kyi skye mched nyid yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po lnga po dag ni chos kyi skye mched nyid yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus the five sense faculties are excluded from the sense base of mental objects.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni yid kyi yul 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi rten yang yin te ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni yid kyi yul 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi rten yang yin te ;
translated: For they are not only the objects of the mental faculty, they are also its support.

original: yid ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental faculty is defined as the group of six consciousnesses.

original: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: The summary verse:

original: dbang po gang gi don gang nyid yin pa gnyis tshan lnga dag go //
analyzed: dbang po gang gi don gang nyid yin pa gnyis tshan lnga dag go //
translated: The five pairs are the sense faculties and their objects.

original: gang nyid kyi ni don nyid gang //
analyzed: gang nyid kyi ni don nyid gang //
translated: What is the object of what?

original: gnyis tshan skye mched drug pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis tshan skye mched drug pa yin //
translated: The six pairs are the six sense bases.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa lnga po dag chos kyi skye mched nyid du gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa lnga po dag chos kyi skye mched nyid du gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the five sense faculties, eye, etc., were included in the sense base of mental objects, what would result?

original: skye mched so so ba'i mdo las dge slong dag chos phyi'i skye mched ni skye mched bcu gcig dag gis ma bsdus pa bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o zhes nges par mdzad pa mi mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched so so ba'i mdo las dge slong dag chos phyi'i skye mched ni skye mched bcu gcig dag gis ma bsdus pa bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o zhes nges par mdzad pa mi mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the S≈´tra on the Sense Bases, the Buddha did not make a definitive statement when he said, ‚ÄúMonks, the internal sense base of mental objects is not included in the eleven sense bases. It is not demonstrable and is without obstruction.‚Äù

original: sems ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sems ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: The mind is momentary,

original: gong du 'gro ba yang yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yang de'i rgyun la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gong du 'gro ba yang yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yang de'i rgyun la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: and it is said to go to a higher state. There is no contradiction here, because this statement is made with regard to the continuum of the mind.

original: grib ma dang me 'bar ba 'gro ba bzhin no //
analyzed: grib ma dang me 'bar ba 'gro ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the shadow and the flame of a candle.

original: bden pa rnam bzhi dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang / gcig ces grangs tha dad par gsungs pa gang yin pa der yang dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: bden pa rnam bzhi dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang / gcig ces grangs tha dad par gsungs pa gang yin pa der yang dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: The Buddha spoke of four, three, two, and one truth, but there is no contradiction here, because he had different intentions in these statements.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs gnyis mdor bsdus na rgyu dang 'bras bu phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin par dgongs te bden pa bzhi dag tu gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs gnyis mdor bsdus na rgyu dang 'bras bu phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin par dgongs te bden pa bzhi dag tu gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The two sides of complete afflictions and complete purification are, in brief, the cause and effect of what is unerring, and thus the four truths were taught.

original: ming gi bram ze rnams mngon par @94a * //
analyzed: ming gi bram ze rnams mngon par @94a * //
translated: The Brahmins of the name

original: mtho ba'i rgyu'i skabs su las dang las kyi 'bras bu dang bdag ni de'i bdag po yin pa'i dbang du byas nas go rims bzhin du mchod sbyin rnams la sems can de dang de dag ni gsad par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: mtho ba'i rgyu'i skabs su las dang las kyi 'bras bu dang bdag ni de'i bdag po yin pa'i dbang du byas nas go rims bzhin du mchod sbyin rnams la sems can de dang de dag ni gsad par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba dang /
translated: In the context of the causes of high status, the Brahmins of the name, in terms of the self being the owner of karma, the results of karma, and so on, respectively posit the three truths of the Brahmins: ‚ÄúIn the sacrifices, this and that being is to be killed.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúOne attains the eternal world.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten rtag pa dag 'thob bo zhes bya ba dang ; de'i 'bras bu bdag la 'byung bas bdag ni de'i 'bras bu la zab yin no zhes bram ze'i bden pa gsum dag tu rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag pa dag 'thob bo zhes bya ba dang ; de'i 'bras bu bdag la 'byung bas bdag ni de'i 'bras bu la zab yin no zhes bram ze'i bden pa gsum dag tu rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúSince the result of that occurs to me, I am the enjoyer of its result.‚Äù

original: de yang don yang dag pa'i bram ze'i rnams la brdzun pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang don yang dag pa'i bram ze'i rnams la brdzun pa yin no //
translated: But that is false for the Brahmins of the meaning.

original: bzlog na ni bden pa yin pa'i phyir de la dgongs nas bram ze'i bden pa gsum du gsungs so //
analyzed: bzlog na ni bden pa yin pa'i phyir de la dgongs nas bram ze'i bden pa gsum du gsungs so //
translated: If it were the opposite, it would be true, and with that in mind, the three Brahmic truths were taught.

original: 'jig rten ba'i shes pa ma 'khrul ba'i yul dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i yul la dgongs nas bden pa gnyis po kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ba'i shes pa ma 'khrul ba'i yul dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i yul la dgongs nas bden pa gnyis po kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden par gsungs so //
translated: With the object of non-erroneous mundane cognition and the object of supramundane cognition in mind, the two truths were taught: conventional truth and ultimate truth.

original: brjod pa ni kun rdzob yin pas des khong du chud par bya ba'i bden pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa ni kun rdzob yin pas des khong du chud par bya ba'i bden pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin te /
translated: Since expression is conventional, the truth that is to be understood by that is conventional truth.

original: gang la brjod par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: gang la brjod par 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is that in regard to which expression operates.

original: dper na rkang pa gnyis kyis brgal bar bya ba'i 'bab stegs la rkang pa'i 'bab stegs zhes bya ba dang / ko grus brgal bar bya ba'i 'bab stegs la ko gru'i 'bab stegs zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rkang pa gnyis kyis brgal bar bya ba'i 'bab stegs la rkang pa'i 'bab stegs zhes bya ba dang / ko grus brgal bar bya ba'i 'bab stegs la ko gru'i 'bab stegs zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a ford that is to be crossed by two feet is called a ford for the feet, and a ford that is to be crossed by a boat is called a ford for boats.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni ye shes dam pa yin no //üîΩde'i don yin pas don dam pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni ye shes dam pa yin no // de'i don yin pas don dam pa ste /
translated: Supramundane is the highest wisdom.üîΩSince it is the object of that, it is ultimate.

original: de'i yul gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the object of that.

original: ston pa rnams kyi lugs tha dad pa la dgongs nas bden pa ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: ston pa rnams kyi lugs tha dad pa la dgongs nas bden pa ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: The Teacher, intending the different systems of the teachers, said, ‚ÄúThere is only one truth,

original: gnyis pa med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: there is no second.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba dag ni bden par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba dag ni bden par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Thus, two things that are mutually exclusive cannot be made true.

original: de lta bas na dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir bden pa rnams la grangs tha dad par bstan pa la snga phyi 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir bden pa rnams la grangs tha dad par bstan pa la snga phyi 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, because of the different intentions, there is no contradiction in the teaching of the different enumerations of the truths.

original: kha cig las /
analyzed: kha cig las /
translated: Some s≈´tras say,

original: mi rnams kyis ni 'di na bsod nams dang // sdig pa gang yin gnyis ka byed pa de //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni 'di na bsod nams dang // sdig pa gang yin gnyis ka byed pa de //
translated: ‚ÄúHere, humans create both merit and demerit.‚ÄùüîΩAnd some s≈´tras say, ‚ÄúThe creator is not observed.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / kha cig las byed pa bo mi dmigs so zhes gang gsungs pa gang yin pa der yang dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / kha cig las byed pa bo mi dmigs so zhes gang gsungs pa gang yin pa der yang dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba med de /
translated: But there is no contradiction here because of the different intentions.

original: 'di ltar phung po'i rgyud gang la mi rnams zhes bya ba de la de gnyis kyi rgyud yod cing de kho na la de gnyis kyi 'bras bu 'byung bas 'di las @94b dgongs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po'i rgyud gang la mi rnams zhes bya ba de la de gnyis kyi rgyud yod cing de kho na la de gnyis kyi 'bras bu 'byung bas 'di las @94b dgongs nas /
translated: Thus, in the continuum of the aggregates called ‚Äúhumans,‚Äù both merit and demerit exist and the effects of both arise in that continuum alone.

original: mi rnams kyis ni 'di na bsod nams dang // sdig pa gang yin gnyis ka byed pa de //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni 'di na bsod nams dang // sdig pa gang yin gnyis ka byed pa de //
translated: meritorious and sinful.

original: de yi bdag gir bya ba yin zhing des //üîΩde yang khyer te 'gro bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: de yi bdag gir bya ba yin zhing des // de yang khyer te 'gro bar byed pa yin //
translated: That is what they own,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and that is what they take with them when they go.

original: bdag tu lta bas kun tu brtags pa'i byed pa po rang dbang yod pa la dgongs nas ni byed pa po mi dmigs so zhes gsungs pa yin gyi rgyu tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta bas kun tu brtags pa'i byed pa po rang dbang yod pa la dgongs nas ni byed pa po mi dmigs so zhes gsungs pa yin gyi rgyu tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid las ni ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha spoke with the intention of a creator who is independent and imagined by the view of self, but not with the intention of the collection of causes, because he said:

original: 'di ltar gang zhig phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing phung po gzhan dag tu mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i zhes khyad par du mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing phung po gzhan dag tu mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i zhes khyad par du mdzad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which abandons these aggregates and connects with other aggregates.‚Äù

original: de bas na dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir snga phyi 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir snga phyi 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, because the intentions are different, there is no contradiction between the earlier and later statements.

original: 'dir yang bshad pa /üîΩras bal gyi ni sa bon dang // ma tu lung ga'i me tog la //
analyzed: 'dir yang bshad pa / ras bal gyi ni sa bon dang // ma tu lung ga'i me tog la //
translated: Here we say:üîΩFrom the seed of cottonüîΩand the flower of the madhuka tree,

original: rgya skyegs kyis ni kha bsgyur na //
analyzed: rgya skyegs kyis ni kha bsgyur na //
translated: the fruit of the cotton tree and honey are produced.

original: tshon de nub par gyur kyang ni //
analyzed: tshon de nub par gyur kyang ni //
translated: Even when the dye has disappeared,üîΩthe cloth is still said to be dyed,

original: rgyud la bsgos pa'i rim pa las //üîΩras bal ze ba dmar skye ltar //üîΩlas rnams nub kyang de'i 'bras bu //
analyzed: rgyud la bsgos pa'i rim pa las // ras bal ze ba dmar skye ltar // las rnams nub kyang de'i 'bras bu //
translated: because the process of dyeing has been impressed upon it.üîΩIn the same way, even when the karma has disappeared,

original: skye la de yi chos nyid do //üîΩgzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: skye la de yi chos nyid do // gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: its effect arises, because that is the nature of karma.üîΩWhatever is form is all four great elements and the four great elements as cause.

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bya ba la ci 'di rdzas kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs sam /
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bya ba la ci 'di rdzas kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs sam /
translated: Is this stated from the perspective of substance or from the perspective of a collection?

original: 'on te gong bu'am /
analyzed: 'on te gong bu'am /
translated: Or is it stated from the perspective of type?üîΩWhatever is said to be form is all four great elements and the four great elements as cause.

original: rigs las shin zhes smras pa gang yin pa yang rigs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pas 'di la ji skad smras pa'i nyes pa med de /
analyzed: rigs las shin zhes smras pa gang yin pa yang rigs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pas 'di la ji skad smras pa'i nyes pa med de /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of type, so there is no fault in what was said.

original: de kho na bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted just as it is.

original: de lta na ni mdo sde dang yang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de lta na ni mdo sde dang yang mi 'gal te /
translated: In that case, it is not contradictory to the sutra.

original: skye mched so so ba'i mdo sde las skye mched dgu po rnams ni re re yang rigs smos pas ji ltar srid pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir 'dus pa re re ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched so so ba'i mdo sde las skye mched dgu po rnams ni re re yang rigs smos pas ji ltar srid pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir 'dus pa re re ni ma yin no //
translated: In the sutra on the individual bases, it is said that each of the nine bases is derived from the four great elements, as the case may be, by mentioning their type.

original: lag pa rdob pa lta bu las ji skad gsungs pa de kho na bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lag pa rdob pa lta bu las ji skad gsungs pa de kho na bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not that each of the collections is derived from the four great elements, because the Buddha accepted that the great elements are like the clapping of hands.

original: 'di ltar mig gi sha'i gong bu la 'byung ba thams cad kyi rgyu las byas pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi sha'i gong bu la 'byung ba thams cad kyi rgyu las byas pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: For, in the eye, a mass of flesh, all the elements are perceived as the cause of the eye.

original: de lta bas na ji skad smras pa'i rigs pa dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji skad smras pa'i rigs pa dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction with the reasoning stated above.

original: gzugs 'das pa yod do //
analyzed: gzugs 'das pa yod do //
translated: Past form exists.

original: gzugs ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Future form exists.

original: de 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa de lta bur ni yod ces bya ba'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no //üîΩji ltar na de @95a * //
analyzed: de 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa de lta bur ni yod ces bya ba'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no // ji ltar na de @95a * //
translated: But it is not that past or future form exists in the way that present form exists.

original: 'das pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it past?

original: sngon byung ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sngon byung ba nyid kyis so //
translated: because it has already occurred.

original: ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be future?

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis te /
translated: Because it will occur,

original: sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its seed exists.

original: de ltar na de yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, it exists.

original: de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears in this way.

original: gzhan yang gzugs gang zhig med par yang de yod do zhes bya ba de rigs sam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs gang zhig med par yang de yod do zhes bya ba de rigs sam zhe na /
translated: Moreover, is it reasonable to say that a form exists even though it does not exist?

original: ji ltar gzhan du brjod par bya bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du brjod par bya bar 'gyur //
translated: How can it be said to be other?

original: gzugs 'das pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs 'das pa med do //
translated: One should say that past form does not exist.

original: gzugs ma 'ongs pa med do zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs ma 'ongs pa med do zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: One should say that future form does not exist.

original: de ltar brjod na gzugs sngon byung ba nyid dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid la skur par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brjod na gzugs sngon byung ba nyid dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid la skur par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says this, one denies that form has already occurred and will occur.

original: 'o na de ltar na ni gzugs 'das pa sngon byung ba dang / gzugs ma 'ongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na ni gzugs 'das pa sngon byung ba dang / gzugs ma 'ongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Well then, one should say that past form is that which has already occurred and future form is that which will occur.

original: de ltar brjod na sngon byung ba na de 'das pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar brjod na sngon byung ba na de 'das pa yin gyi /
translated: If one says this, then that which has already occurred in the past is past.

original: da ltar ni 'das pa ma yin pas 'das pa nyid las rab tu nyams pa yin par bstan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: da ltar ni 'das pa ma yin pas 'das pa nyid las rab tu nyams pa yin par bstan par 'gyur la /
translated: But if it is present, it is not past, and it is taught that it has fallen away from being past.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni de ma 'ongs pa yin gyi /üîΩda ltar ni ma 'ongs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni de ma 'ongs pa yin gyi / da ltar ni ma 'ongs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it is future, it is not present.

original: ma 'ongs pa nyid kyang ma phyin pa zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa nyid kyang ma phyin pa zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is present, it is not future, and it is taught that it has not yet arrived, that it is not yet come.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod pa nyid kyis kyang byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don smos pa'i phyir zlos bur bstan par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod pa nyid kyis kyang byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don smos pa'i phyir zlos bur bstan par 'gyur ro ;
translated: And since it is said to be past and future, it is taught that it is a repetition, since the meaning of ‚Äúarisen‚Äù and ‚Äúwill arise‚Äù is mentioned.

original: / gal te de ltar bstan pa la dga' na ni yod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra de nyid tshig gi phrad yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs par dus gsum gyi yul yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / gal te de ltar bstan pa la dga' na ni yod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra de nyid tshig gi phrad yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs par dus gsum gyi yul yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If you like this teaching, then the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù should be understood to refer to the three times, as is appropriate, since it is a verbal prefix.

original: de lta bas na ji ltar bkod pa nyid rigs pa yin no //üîΩgal te gzugs kyi mtshan nyid thal ba'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na ji ltar bkod pa nyid rigs pa yin no // gal te gzugs kyi mtshan nyid thal ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the way it is presented is correct.

original: ma grub pa yin na de ji ltar gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ma grub pa yin na de ji ltar gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If the characteristic of form is a logical possibility or unestablished, how can it be called form?

original: sngon 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tha snyad kyis te /
analyzed: sngon 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tha snyad kyis te /
translated: The past and future are designated by the conventions of past and future.

original: dper na sa bon nyams pa zhes bya ba dang / phye btag go zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon nyams pa zhes bya ba dang / phye btag go zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying the seed is damaged and the flour is ground.

original: las zad pa dang / 'das pa dang / 'gags pa dang / bral ba dang / yongs su gyur pa gang yin pa de yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni des sems kyi rgyud la 'bras bu 'byin pa'i nus pa skyed pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin pa'i don rtogs pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las zad pa dang / 'das pa dang / 'gags pa dang / bral ba dang / yongs su gyur pa gang yin pa de yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni des sems kyi rgyud la 'bras bu 'byin pa'i nus pa skyed pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin pa'i don rtogs pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúWhatever is the exhaustion, the past, the cessation, the separation, and the transformation of karma, that exists‚Äù is understood to be stated with the intention that it generates the power to produce a result in the mindstream. It is not tenable to interpret it otherwise.

original: de las skyes pa la de gdags pa ni grong la spyod do //
analyzed: de las skyes pa la de gdags pa ni grong la spyod do //
translated: The designation of that is applied to what arises from it, as in the expressions ‚Äúhe lives in the village‚Äù and ‚Äúhe eats rice.‚Äù

original: pa na za'o zhes bya ba yin zhing ji skad @95b du reg pa'i skye mched drug po de sngon mngon par 'dus byas pa la mngon par bsams pa 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: pa na za'o zhes bya ba yin zhing ji skad @95b du reg pa'i skye mched drug po de sngon mngon par 'dus byas pa la mngon par bsams pa 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu yang yin no //
translated: And it is like the statement, ‚ÄúThe six bases of contact that have arisen from that should be known as past karma, having been previously accumulated and contemplated.‚Äù

original: dgongs ba 'dis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du gsungs pa de dang / mig ni ma skyes pa las skye zhing skyes nas kyang 'jig go zhes bya ba yang rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgongs ba 'dis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du gsungs pa de dang / mig ni ma skyes pa las skye zhing skyes nas kyang 'jig go zhes bya ba yang rigs pa yin no //
translated: And by this intention, it is correct to say that the past and future exist, and that the eye arises from what is not arisen and having arisen, it is destroyed.

original: de lta bas na 'dir yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba med cing snga phyi 'gal ba yang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba med cing snga phyi 'gal ba yang med do //
translated: Therefore, here there is no contradiction with direct perception and there is no contradiction with past and future.

original: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa yang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa yang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The inference that the escape from form is the formless is also contradictory.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la rag las te skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang de yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la rag las te skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang de yin te /
translated: As for what was said, ‚Äúbecause it is seen that feeling and so on arise in dependence on form,‚Äù that is so.

original: da ltar gzugs las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams gzugs dang lhan cig tu lus mngon par 'grub pa ni mthong ngo //
analyzed: da ltar gzugs las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams gzugs dang lhan cig tu lus mngon par 'grub pa ni mthong ngo //
translated: But it is seen that those who are not free from attachment to form now establish the body together with form.

original: gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni gzugs med bzhin du lus mngon par 'grub pa yin pas rjes su dpag pa de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni gzugs med bzhin du lus mngon par 'grub pa yin pas rjes su dpag pa de mi 'thad do //
translated: But those who are free from attachment to the form realm manifest a body in the formless realm. Therefore your inference is untenable.

original: skyed pa'i lta ba dang / slu ba'i lta ba dang / khas mi len pa'i lta ba dang / ngan g-yo'i lta ba dang / tshar gcod pa'i lta ba dang / bkur stir lta ba dang / skur pa'i lta ba dang / rmongs pa nyid tshabs che ba'i lta ba dang /
analyzed: skyed pa'i lta ba dang / slu ba'i lta ba dang / khas mi len pa'i lta ba dang / ngan g-yo'i lta ba dang / tshar gcod pa'i lta ba dang / bkur stir lta ba dang / skur pa'i lta ba dang / rmongs pa nyid tshabs che ba'i lta ba dang /
translated: the view of production, the view of deception, the view of non-acceptance, the view of trickery, the view of refutation, the view of respect, the view of denigration, the view of great delusion,

original: kha na ma thob nyid kyi lta ba dang ; lta ba chen po dang / mngon ba'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma thob nyid kyi lta ba dang ; lta ba chen po dang / mngon ba'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba'o //
translated: the view of mere non-obstruction, the view of great view, and the view of manifest pride.

original: rigs kyi bu de la mtshan mar lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de la mtshan mar lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: Son of noble family, what is the view of signs?

original: ngas kun tu sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas chos rnams kyi med ba nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de la sgra ji bzhin gyi don du mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la yang med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa na med pa nyid du mtshan mar bzung nas med par lta ba 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ngas kun tu sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas chos rnams kyi med ba nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de la sgra ji bzhin gyi don du mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la yang med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa na med pa nyid du mtshan mar bzung nas med par lta ba 'byung ba ste /
translated: I teach the nonexistence of all things intending the essential nature that arises from the bonds. When one adheres to the literal meaning of that, and when one adheres to the nonexistence of the things that are afflicted and the things that are pure, then the view of nonexistence arises, having taken nonexistence as a sign.

original: de lta bas na mtshan mar lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan mar lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe view of signs.‚Äù

original: de la lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med par lta ba de la mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med par lta ba de la mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe view of the non-view‚Äù is the view of the bodhisattva. When one adheres to that view of nonexistence, the notion arises that it is not a view.

original: med par lta ba gang yin pa de ni de'i lta ba chen po yin te /
analyzed: med par lta ba gang yin pa de ni de'i lta ba chen po yin te /
translated: That view of nonexistence is his great view.

original: de lta bas na lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe view of the non-view.‚Äù

original: de la tha snyad la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na nyid la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni mtshan mar lta ba des thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa na tha snyad la skur pa 'debs bar lta ba la yang mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: de la tha snyad la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na nyid la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni mtshan mar lta ba des thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa na tha snyad la skur pa 'debs bar lta ba la yang mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: The view that denies conventional usage, the view that denies the afflictions, and the view that denies reality, when one denies everything through the view of signs, one becomes attached to the view that denies conventional usage,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la yang mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la yang mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: one becomes attached to the view that denies the afflictions,

original: de kho na nyid la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la yang mngon par zhen par byed do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la yang mngon par zhen par byed do //
translated: and one becomes attached to the view that denies reality.

original: de lta bas na tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view that denies conventional usage,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: it is called the view that denies the afflictions,

original: de kho na nyid la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: and it is called the view that denies reality.

original: de la sbyor ba gtong ba'i lta ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba can de nyid phyis gang gis khyad par du 'gro ba las yongs su nyams bar 'gyur ba rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i sbyor ba gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba gtong ba'i lta ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba can de nyid phyis gang gis khyad par du 'gro ba las yongs su nyams bar 'gyur ba rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i sbyor ba gtong ba'o //
translated: The view of giving up application is the view of the one who denies, who later falls away from the special qualities that he has attained, by giving up the application that distinguishes them.

original: de la yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta @103a * //
analyzed: de la yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta @103a * //
translated: The view of grasping is the view of the one who does not consider a view to be a view,

original: ba dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / sbyor ba gtong ba'i lta ba can de nyid gzhan dag dang lhan cig tu chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gtan la dbab par byed pa na med pa'i phyogs kho nar yongs su 'dzin pas na de lta bas na yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / sbyor ba gtong ba'i lta ba can de nyid gzhan dag dang lhan cig tu chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gtan la dbab par byed pa na med pa'i phyogs kho nar yongs su 'dzin pas na de lta bas na yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: the view of the one who denies, and the view of the one who gives up application. When he is determining the characteristics of the Dharma with others, he grasps only the side of non-existence. Therefore, it is called the view of grasping.

original: de la sgyur ba'i lta ba ni gal te theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i don gyi bsngags pa brjod pa na 'di dag thams cad ni med pa'i don ston pa yin no zhes don de dag lta ba de kho nar sgyur bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sgyur ba'i lta ba ni gal te theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i don gyi bsngags pa brjod pa na 'di dag thams cad ni med pa'i don ston pa yin no zhes don de dag lta ba de kho nar sgyur bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The view of transformation is that when the meaning of the Mahayana sutras is praised, one transforms the meaning of all of them into the view that they teach the meaning of nonexistence.

original: de lta bas na sgyur ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgyur ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of transformation.

original: rigs kyi bu de la nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba gang yin pa dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba gang yin pa de ni bdag gam gzhan gyi phyir re zhig theg pa dman pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byin pa ma yin na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lta ci smos pa ste /üîΩde lta bas na nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de la nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba gang yin pa dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba gang yin pa de ni bdag gam gzhan gyi phyir re zhig theg pa dman pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byin pa ma yin na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lta ci smos pa ste / de lta bas na nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, the view that does not lead to deliverance is the view of grasping and the view of transformation. For the sake of oneself or others, it does not lead to deliverance through the Hinayana, let alone to complete and supreme awakening.üîΩTherefore, it is called the view that does not lead to deliverance.

original: de la kha na ma thob med pa nyid du lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la kha na ma thob med pa nyid du lta ba ni /
translated: The view of non-offense is as follows.

original: de med pa'i mtshan ma nyid du lta bar gyur nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de med pa'i mtshan ma nyid du lta bar gyur nas 'di lta ste /
translated: Having seen the signless as nonexistent, the view arises that

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig lta ba 'di dang ldan na 'khrul ba'i nyes byas cung zad spyad kyang de la thams cad du kha na ma tho bar mi 'gyur bar lta ba 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig lta ba 'di dang ldan na 'khrul ba'i nyes byas cung zad spyad kyang de la thams cad du kha na ma tho bar mi 'gyur bar lta ba 'byung ba ste /
translated: whatever bodhisattva possesses this view, even if he should engage in some slight misdeed out of confusion, it will not become a fault for him at all.

original: de bas na kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid du lta ba zhes bya'o //üîΩde la nges par 'byung bar lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid 'di snyam du med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba 'di ni nyes byas kyi kha na ma tho ba thams cad las nges par 'byung ba yin no snyam
analyzed: de bas na kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid du lta ba zhes bya'o // de la nges par 'byung bar lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid 'di snyam du med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba 'di ni nyes byas kyi kha na ma tho ba thams cad las nges par 'byung ba yin no snyam
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of non-fault.

original: du sems pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: du sems pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The view of deliverance is the thought of the bodhisattva who has the view of the signless as nonexistent: ‚ÄúThis view of the signless as nonexistent is the deliverance from all misdeeds and faults.‚Äù

original: de nges par 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nges par 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not deliverance.

original: de lta bas na nges par 'byung bar lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nges par 'byung bar lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of deliverance.

original: kha na ma tho ba nyid dang / nges par 'byung bar lta bdag nyid sgrib pa la sogs pa'i lta ba yin te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba nyid dang / nges par 'byung bar lta bdag nyid sgrib pa la sogs pa'i lta ba yin te /
translated: The view of the obscurations, etc. is the view of the very obscurations, the view of the very non-deliverance, the view of the very non-relinquishment, the view of the very non-purification, the view of the very non-production, the view of the very non-cessation, the view of the very non-defilement, and the view of the very non-purification.

original: sgrib pa'i rgyu de la de'i gnyen po yin par blo 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i rgyu de la de'i gnyen po yin par blo 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind arises as the antidote to that cause of the obscurations.

original: de la brnyas pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid nyan thos kyi theg pa la chos 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' goms bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la brnyas pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid nyan thos kyi theg pa la chos 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' goms bar mi bya'o //
translated: The view of contempt is the view of the Bodhisattva as a sign of non-existence, and the view that these dharmas are not to be practiced by the Bodhisattva in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle.

original: chos 'di dag ni dman pa yin pas 'di dag la byang @103b chub sems dpas mkhas ba nyid du mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni dman pa yin pas 'di dag la byang @103b chub sems dpas mkhas ba nyid du mi bya'o //
translated: These dharmas are inferior, so the Bodhisattva should not become skilled in them.

original: chos 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpas thag ring du spang bar bya'o zhes brnyas pa'i sems skye ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpas thag ring du spang bar bya'o zhes brnyas pa'i sems skye ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: These dharmas are to be abandoned by the Bodhisattva from afar.

original: de lta bas na brnyas pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na brnyas pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That is why it is called the view of contempt.

original: de la 'khrug pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa de dag la 'di dag dang lhan cig gnas par mi bya /
analyzed: de la 'khrug pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa de dag la 'di dag dang lhan cig gnas par mi bya /
translated: The view of conflict is the view of the bodhisattva as a mere sign, and the person who is a ≈õrƒÅvaka-vehicle practitioner should not live with those who have that view.üîΩ

original: gleng ba dang / kun tu gleng ba dang / smra ba dang / gos la sogs pa kun tu spyad pa dang / longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes khong khro ba'i sems ston pa gang yin pa de ;
analyzed: gleng ba dang / kun tu gleng ba dang / smra ba dang / gos la sogs pa kun tu spyad pa dang / longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes khong khro ba'i sems ston pa gang yin pa de ;
translated: The view of agitation is the view of the Bodhisattva as a mere sign, and the view that he is not a Bodhisattva. The view of agitation is the view that one should not live with those who are persons of the Disciple Vehicle, should not talk with them, should not converse with them, should not wear the same robes, etc., as they, and should not enjoy the same things as they.üîΩThis is the view of agitation.

original: de lta bas na 'khrug pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khrug pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the view of agitation.

original: de la bsod nams ma yin pa skyed pa'i lta ba ni de nyid brnyas pa'i lta ba dang / 'khrug pa'i lta ba can du gyur na bsod nams ma yin pa mang du bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bsod nams ma yin pa skyed pa'i lta ba ni de nyid brnyas pa'i lta ba dang / 'khrug pa'i lta ba can du gyur na bsod nams ma yin pa mang du bskyed pa yin te /
translated: The view of the production of demerit is the view that one produces much demerit when one becomes a view-possessor who deprecates and agitates.

original: de lta bas na bsod nams ma yin pa skyed pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsod nams ma yin pa skyed pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the view of the production of demerit.

original: de la phyin ci log gi lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid gang gis na de'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bsgom pa de mi 'grub pa stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid du mi rtog pa dang /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log gi lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid gang gis na de'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bsgom pa de mi 'grub pa stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid du mi rtog pa dang /
translated: As for the wrong view, it is the view of those who do not have bodhicitta, who see signs of nonexistence, who do not conceive of emptiness as emptiness, and who do not accomplish the three kinds of meditative absorption.

original: mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma med pa nyid du mi rtog pa dang / smon pa med pa la smon pa med pa nyid du mi rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma med pa nyid du mi rtog pa dang / smon pa med pa la smon pa med pa nyid du mi rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The view of error is that of the bodhisattva who has the view of the signlessness of nonexistence, and it is the non-conception of emptiness as emptiness, of the signless as signless, and of the wishless as wishless, by which the three kinds of concentration are not accomplished.

original: de lta bas na phyin ci log gi lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na phyin ci log gi lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the view of error.

original: de la ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' phyin ci log gi lta ba can de'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ngal ba 'bras bu med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' phyin ci log gi lta ba can de'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ngal ba 'bras bu med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The view of fruitless toil is the fruitless toil of the bodhisattva who has the view of error in the cultivation of concentration.

original: de lta bas na ngal ba 'bras bu med ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ngal ba 'bras bu med ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the view of fruitless toil.

original: de la skyed pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gang lta ba de la skye bo'i tshogs chen po yang dag bar len du 'jug cing skye bo'i tshogs chen po dad par byed
analyzed: de la skyed pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gang lta ba de la skye bo'i tshogs chen po yang dag bar len du 'jug cing skye bo'i tshogs chen po dad par byed
translated: The view that generates is the view of bodhisattvas who lack the sign of reality. It is as follows. Bodhisattvas cause a great multitude of beings to take up that view and cause that great multitude of beings to have faith in it.üîΩ

original: pa de ni bsod nams mang po skyed pa yin no zhes lta ba 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: pa de ni bsod nams mang po skyed pa yin no zhes lta ba 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The view of production is the view of bodhisattvas who are not skilled in means, who have the view of signs, and who think, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who causes a great multitude to take up the view and to have faith in it produces much merit.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na skyed pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na skyed pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus it is called the view of production.

original: de la slu ba'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' skyes pa'i lta ba can bsod nams kyi bsam pa can de bdag gam gzhan las bsod nams slu ba 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /üîΩde lta bas @104a * //
analyzed: de la slu ba'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' skyes pa'i lta ba can bsod nams kyi bsam pa can de bdag gam gzhan las bsod nams slu ba 'byung ba gang yin pa ste / de lta bas @104a * //
translated: The view of deception is the view of bodhisattvas who are skilled in means, who have the view of emptiness, and who think, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who causes a great multitude to take up the view and to have faith in it produces much merit.‚Äù

original: na slu ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: na slu ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus it is called the view of deception.

original: de la khas mi len pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid 'di snyam du bdag gis chos thams cad med pa nyid 'di la gzhan dag dang rtsod bar byed pa na yang phyogs 'ga' yang khas blangs bar miüîΩbya zhing / bdag gis sun ci phyin ba 'ba' zhig bya'o snyam du sems pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la khas mi len pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba can de nyid 'di snyam du bdag gis chos thams cad med pa nyid 'di la gzhan dag dang rtsod bar byed pa na yang phyogs 'ga' yang khas blangs bar mi bya zhing / bdag gis sun ci phyin ba 'ba' zhig bya'o snyam du sems pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The view of non-acceptance is the view of the bodhisattva who sees the sign of non-existence. He thinks, ‚ÄúWhen I argue with others about the non-existence of all phenomena, I will not accept any position at all, and I will only refute them.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na khas mi len pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na khas mi len pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of non-acceptance.

original: de la ngan g-yo'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med ba mtshan mar lta ba can phyogs khas mi len cing sgra ji bzhin gyi med pa nyid de rnam par 'jog pa de nyid tshig dor ba dang / ltag chod smra ba'i sbyor ba byed do //
analyzed: de la ngan g-yo'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' med ba mtshan mar lta ba can phyogs khas mi len cing sgra ji bzhin gyi med pa nyid de rnam par 'jog pa de nyid tshig dor ba dang / ltag chod smra ba'i sbyor ba byed do //
translated: The view of deception is the view of the bodhisattva who sees the sign of non-existence. He does not accept any position, and he posits the non-existence of the literal meaning. He engages in the practice of quibbling and sophistry.

original: tshig dor ba dang ltag chos smra ba'i sbyor ba ni ngan g-yo smra ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshig dor ba dang ltag chos smra ba'i sbyor ba ni ngan g-yo smra ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The practice of quibbling and sophistry is called the practice of deception.

original: de lta bas na ngan g-yo'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ngan g-yo'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of deception.

original: de la tshar gcad pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' khas mi len ba'i lta ba dang / ngan g-yo'i lta ba can de nyid smra ba snying po med pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis dus thams cad du tshar gcad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la tshar gcad pa'i lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa' khas mi len ba'i lta ba dang / ngan g-yo'i lta ba can de nyid smra ba snying po med pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis dus thams cad du tshar gcad pa yin te /
translated: The view of refutation is the view of the bodhisattva that is not accepted, and the view of deception is always refuted by the wise because it is a worthless teaching.

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo sde dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u la sogs pa dag ji ltar 'os par nges par gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: phyugs dang dud 'gro sna tshogs gsod par byed pa /

original: ci 'o thug dang khvam ra 'dra ba nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'o thug dang khvam ra 'dra ba nyid yin nam /

original: bsad pas mtho ris sam thar pa 'thob bo snyam pa ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: bsad pas mtho ris sam thar pa 'thob bo snyam pa ni gti mug ste /

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo sde las ni ma chags pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i srog gcod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'o zhes yongs su bstan pas de dang der ji ltar na 'dra ba nyid yin /

analyzed: de yongs su gtong ba'i sems nyid gang yin pa de nyid 'dir zhe sdang ma yin nam zhe na /
